title: IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day – ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence 2025’ to Celebrate Global Collaborations – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day – ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence 2025’ to Celebrate Global Collaborations – IIM Indore IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day – ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence 2025’ to Celebrate Global Collaborations Home News And Events IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day – ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence 2025’ to Celebrate Global Collaborations navigate to IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day – ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence 2025’ to Celebrate Global Collaborations The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore), renowned for its dynamic global collaborations and steadfast commitment to building bridges of academic excellence, hosted the second edition of its International Partners’ Day – SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence – on October 8, 2025. The event brought together distinguished academicians and thought leaders from 17 premier partner institutions across 13 countries, including Italy, Russia, the United Kingdom, Norway, Ireland, Germany, the United States, France, Brazil, South Africa, Sweden, Australia, and Romania. The gathering served as a vibrant forum for deepening institutional alliances, discussing the role of innovation and technology in advancing global education, and co-creating pathways for a more sustainable and equitable future. In his welcome address, Prof. Himanshu Rai highlighted IIM Indore’s continued evolution as a global institution deeply engaged in addressing some of the world’s most complex and pressing challenges. He spoke about how the institute is tackling various “wicked problems”, ranging from income disparity and rural issues to urban challenges and environmental problems – through initiatives and collaborations that transcend geographical and disciplinary boundaries. Prof. Rai emphasized that IIM Indore’s collaborations are not just academic exchanges but enduring relationships built on shared values and a collective commitment to societal progress. He reiterated the Institute’s goal of shaping leaders who are not only competent professionals but also compassionate change-makers equipped to navigate uncertainty and drive meaningful impact. A highlight of the event was the engaging panel discussion on “AI for Sustainability,” which featured an exceptional line-up of global experts: Dr. Uttiyo Raychaudhuri, Vice Provost for Internationalization at the University of Denver; Prof. Andrea Sianesi, Dean at MIP Politecnico di Milano Graduate School of Business; Dr. Julia Christine Balogun, Dean at the University of Liverpool; and Dr. Simon Fraser, International Engagement Lead and Principal Lecturer at Aberdeen Business School, Robert Gordon University. The session was moderated by Prof. Sayantan Banerjee, PGP Chair at IIM Indore. The discussion explored how artificial intelligence can be harnessed to promote sustainability, inclusivity, and ethical innovation. The panelists examined how universities can serve as catalysts for responsible technological advancement, ensuring that AI not only enhances efficiency but also contributes to solving global social and environmental challenges. The dialogue centered on the crucial role of education in fostering a future where technology and humanity advance in tandem. The day also featured a series of thought-provoking presentations that highlighted IIM Indore’s distinctive initiatives, aimed at driving sustainable development, cultural preservation, and leadership through experiential learning. Prof. Shruti Tewari (Dean – Research) shared how ANVESHAN, IIM Indore’s Centre of Excellence on Waste Management and WASH (Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene), adopts an interdisciplinary approach to translating research into real-world impact, as well as its efforts to train policymakers and urban leaders in sustainable waste management practices. Prof. Srinivas Gunta shared insights on the Rural Engagement Programme (REP), which immerses students in rural communities to co-create solutions for local development while nurturing empathy-driven leadership. Prof. Surbhi Dayal shared a colourful presentation on Mithila Art for Managers – an elective for our MBA students – illustrating how this ancient artistic tradition embodies resilience, storytelling, and creativity, qualities essential for holistic leadership and cultural understanding. Prof. Kamal Sharma shared insights into our Himalayan Outbound Programme (HOP), which integrates experiential learning and leadership development amid the challenging terrains of the Himalayas, boosting self-awareness, teamwork, and strategic thinking. The delegates also participated in a campus tour and a tree plantation ceremony, symbolizing growth, renewal, and the enduring strength of international partnerships. The atmosphere was filled with camaraderie and shared purpose as participants from across continents exchanged ideas and envisioned new collaborations. A rejuvenating yoga session led by Prof. Himanshu Rai was also held in the serene Spiritual Garden, where international delegates participated in a meditative practice that emphasized mindfulness, balance, and harmony, the very principles that reflect IIM Indore’s vision for global collaboration rooted in awareness and well-being. This created a sense of unity and reflection, setting a meaningful tone for the day’s engagements. The delegates were also treated to a captivating cultural excursion to the historic town of Maheshwar, a timeless gem nestled along the tranquil banks of the Narmada River. Renowned for its majestic temples, exquisite handloom sarees, and regal architecture, Maheshwar offered participants a glimpse into the region’s rich artistic and spiritual heritage. The visit served as a fitting reminder of the deep cultural traditions that inspire creativity, resilience, and community, values that resonate strongly with IIM Indore’s ethos. Through ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence 2025,’ IIM Indore once again reaffirmed its position as a pioneer in cultivating enduring global partnerships that transcend borders, disciplines, and cultures. The event was far more than a forum for academic exchange, it was a celebration of shared purpose, global unity, and the collective pursuit of sustainable and inclusive progress. Delegates experienced the warmth of Indian hospitality and the vibrant cultural spirit of the campus, departing with renewed inspiration to strengthen the bridges of learning, innovation, and mutual growth that connect institutions across the world. title: Mimamsa: The HR Conclave Held at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: Mimamsa: The HR Conclave Held at IIM Indore – IIM Indore Mimamsa: The HR Conclave Held at IIM Indore Home News And Events Mimamsa: The HR Conclave Held at IIM Indore navigate to Mimamsa: The HR Conclave Held at IIM Indore The Post Graduate Programme in Human Resource Management (PGPHRM) at IIM Indore hosted its annual HR Conclave, Mimamsa, on 4th October 2025, bringing together prominent leaders from industry and academia for a day of insightful dialogue on the ethical, cultural and technological shifts shaping the future of work and education. The event was inaugurated by IIM Indore’s Director, Prof. Himanshu Rai. Prof. Nobin Thomas, Chair – PGPHRM was also present on this occasion. In his inaugural address, Prof. Rai challenged conventional definitions of leadership, reflecting on how influence alone cannot be the sole qualifier of a leader. Drawing from history and mythology, he mentioned that leadership should be anchored in moral responsibility. He emphasised that truth and righteousness are not always identical, urging future leaders to cultivate the wisdom to differentiate between what is factually correct and what is ethically just. Introducing his Be–Know–Do framework, he urged the audience to Be responsible and value-driven, Know their identity beyond temporary titles, and Do what is right even when it is inconvenient. He concluded by inviting participants to treat Mimamsa not merely as an event but as a space for introspection and transformation. The day’s discussions commenced with a panel on the theme – Reimagining Learning and Culture – Empowering Agile, AI-ready Talent, moderated by Prof. Jatin Pandey, Faculty in the OB&HRM Area at IIM Indore. The conversation featured Mr. Gautam Duggal, (SVP, Citi), Mr. Abraham Zachariah (SVP, HSBC), Mr. Sahil Nayar (Senior Associate Director, KPMG), and Mr. Manu S. Varma (Head HR, ITC), who reflected on the growing interplay between artificial intelligence and human intelligence in organisational decision-making. The panel agreed that as automation replaces transactional roles, the value of human contribution increasingly lies in contextual judgement, creativity and empathy. What emerged strongly was the belief that mindset now outweighs mere skillset, and emotional intelligence may well become the defining differentiator of leadership in an AI-accelerated era. The dialogue then shifted to the evolving role of higher education in modern society in a conversation moderated by Prof. Swati Ghulyani, Faculty in the OB&HRM Area at IIM Indore. This panel themed Universities of the Future: Balancing Tradition, Technology & Global Relevance was joined by Dr. Paul Wilson, Principal of Madras Christian College, and Dr. D. Pandiaraja, Principal and Director of Thiagarajar College, Madurai, who reflected on the challenges of balancing rootedness in tradition with adaptability to global expectations. They advocated for an educational paradigm that moves beyond instruction to facilitation, from rote to reflection, and from curriculum-based delivery to context-based discovery. The speakers reiterated that universities today must nurture global citizens with local grounding, capable of interpretation rather than imitation. Furthering the continuum between academia and industry, Prof. Ranjeet Nambudiri, Faculty in the OB&HRM Area at IIM Indore, moderated a discussion themed Building Future-Ready Organizations: Harnessing IR, Technology, and People-Centric Leadership, featuring Mr. Rengarajan Alagar, Regional HR Integration Manager at Maersk, Dr. Rajen Mehrotra, Former Senior Employers’ Specialist at the ILO South Asia, Mr. Yashwant Chauhan, CHRM and Deputy HR Head JLPL at GAIL, and Ms. Crystal Pinto, Vice President – Learning and Development at Reliance Nippon Life Insurance. The group reflected on the rapid shifts in workforce expectations, emphasising the need for organisations to humanise systems without compromising efficiency. They underscored that policy, governance and culture must evolve simultaneously to enable agility without eroding dignity. The conclave culminated in a panel on mentorship and campus life, moderated by Prof. Amitabh Kodwani, Faculty in the OB&HRM Area at IIM Indore. The session featured Dr. Kanika K. Ahuja, Acting Principal of Lady Shri Ram College, Dr. Jossy P. George, Director Christ University, and Dr. P. B. Harathi, Principal of PSGR Krishnammal College for Women, who reflected on the changing aspirations and anxieties of the youth. They highlighted that while infrastructure and pedagogy continue to evolve, the essence of education lies in emotional scaffolding and ethical grounding. Mentorship, they agreed, must evolve from supervision to partnership. Mimamsa 2025 concluded not with prescriptions but with provocations. Rather than offering quick solutions, the conclave left attendees with enduring questions — How do we build technologically advanced yet deeply humane institutions? Can agility coexist with reflection? Can ambition grow without eroding empathy? The event reaffirmed IIM Indore’s belief that leadership must be measured not only by what it achieves, but by what it enables — not just in systems, but within people. Previous Next

title: IIM Indore Celebrates its 29th Foundation Day – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Celebrates its 29th Foundation Day – IIM Indore IIM Indore Celebrates its 29th Foundation Day Home News And Events IIM Indore Celebrates its 29th Foundation Day navigate to IIM Indore Celebrates its 29th Foundation Day The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) celebrated its 29th Foundation Day today, marking another significant moment in its journey of excellence, innovation, and societal impact. The occasion brought together faculty, staff, students, and members of the IIM Indore community in a celebration of shared purpose and institutional pride. In his Foundation Day Address, Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, reflected on the institute’s evolution and its expanding global stature. Invoking timeless philosophy, he emphasized that true greatness is not defined by momentary recognition but by steadfast progress and purpose-driven impact. He described IIM Indore as a powerful beacon on the world stage, with its light strengthened by a deep commitment to knowledge, inclusivity, and societal relevance. “At IIM Indore, our journey is guided by the mind, the body, and the soul. The mind drives innovation and inquiry, the body turns ideas into action, and the soul anchors us in values and purpose. Together, they ensure we pursue not just success, but significance”, he said. Prof. Rai noted that with the upcoming calendar enriched with global events, IIM Indore is poised to further consolidate its standing among the world’s leading institutions. He highlighted the institute’s recent accomplishments with pride, including: 69th globally in the Financial Times Global MBA Rankings 2025 4th Best Indian B-School in the world in the QS Global MBA Rankings 2025 Among the Top 40 institutions globally on the LinkedIn MBA list He remarked that such recognitions are not merely accolades, but affirmations of the collective vision, effort, and aspiration that define IIM Indore’s legacy. A highlight of the day was the felicitation of faculty and staff for their outstanding contributions. The Best Teacher Award for 2024 was conferred upon Prof. Prashant Salwan in recognition of his exceptional dedication to teaching and his ability to inspire students. The celebrations also included special recognition for pedagogical excellence. Prof. Ganesh Nidugala received the Best Case Award for his case titled ‘Indian Rupee Crisis of 2013’. The Best Teaching Innovation Award was conferred upon Prof. Sanjeev Tripathi for pioneering innovative approaches in classroom pedagogy that enhance student engagement and learning impact. Faculty members who ranked in the top 5% based on student feedback in degree-granting programmes were also honored: Manoj Motiani Bhavin J. Shah Harshal Lowalekar Shrihari S. Sohani Jatin Pandey Saumya Ranjan Dash The institute further recognized the commitment and diligence of its staff through the Best Employee Awards, presented this year to: Kamlesh Bhatia Anurag Kumar Rai Shyam Rao Satendra Singh Rawat Foundation Day also served as an occasion to honor the long-standing dedication of IIM Indore’s employees. The 10-Year Service Awards, 20-Year Service Awards, and 25-Year Service Awards were also presented. With a strong foundation established over the past 29 years, IIM Indore continues to set new benchmarks in management education and societal impact. The coming months will see IIM Indore emerge as a dynamic hub of global engagement and intellectual discourse. The institute will host: International Partners’ Day, a platform for institutions across the world to come together in a spirit of collaboration, shared purpose, and trust. Sport and Business Conference 2.0 on 9–10 October, exploring the theme “Is India Ready to Host the 2036 Olympics?”: a timely reflection on national ambition, infrastructure, and collective imagination. The 18th All India Conference of China Studies from 24–26 October, examining “Rewiring Globalization: The China Factor in Trade, Technology, and Sustainability in a Multipolar World.” The landmark 18th Eduniversal World Convention, reiterating IIM Indore’s leadership and intent-driven excellence on the global stage. The 29th Foundation Day not only celebrated the institute’s rich legacy but also reaffirmed its enduring commitment to shaping leaders who are socially conscious, ethically grounded, and equipped to create meaningful impact. title: IIM Indore Concludes Latest Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN Centre of Excellence – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Concludes Latest Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN Centre of Excellence – IIM Indore IIM Indore Concludes Latest Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN Centre of Excellence Home News And Events IIM Indore Concludes Latest Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN Centre of Excellence navigate to IIM Indore Concludes Latest Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN Centre of Excellence IIM Indore conducts Shram Daan with swachhata champions from across seven states IIM Indore successfully concluded its latest batch of the Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN, the institute’s Centre of Excellence for Waste Management and WASH (Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene), in collaboration with the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA). The four-day programme, held from September 22 to 25, brought together 37 senior commissioners and CMOs from seven states , namely, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Jharkhand, Himachal Pradesh, Bihar, and Chhattisgarh, for a comprehensive learning experience. Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, highlighted the importance of education, awareness, and janbhagidari for nation-building. “Leadership is about taking responsibility and creating impact. True education frees us from the notion of ‘this isn’t my responsibility.’ Together with MoHUA, we aim to nurture leaders who drive India towards a cleaner, healthier future,” he said. He further emphasized that leadership in the context of urban transformation is not limited to policies or systems but lies equally in inspiring communities and enabling collaboration at every level. Reflecting on Indore’s success story, he noted that the city became a model for the nation not just because of efficient systems but because of collective ownership, continuous innovation, and the belief that change is possible. He urged participants to replicate this spirit in their own cities, blending knowledge with empathy and vision with action. The programme featured an exceptional lineup of sessions covering critical aspects of urban governance, sanitation, and waste management. Topics included accelerating SBM-U 2.0 implementation, integrated solid waste management, offering holistic approaches that combined innovative practices with practical solutions; organic and wet waste management, optimizing dry waste collection, segregation, and transportation, and managing end-to-end city-level solid waste operations. Participants also explored legacy waste remediation, used water management for small and medium cities, and behavioral change communication and community participation strategies. Further discussions addressed design and maintenance of public toilets, manhole to machine hole transformation, structuring projects for SWM and used water management, frameworks for Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR), digital solutions in sanitation and waste management, and project monitoring through GMIS. Throughout, officials gained practical insights into implementing sustainable, scalable solutions while driving public engagement and systemic improvement. Participants also had a hands-on exposure visit to the Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC), observing best practices and successful implementation strategies that have made Indore a model city in urban sanitation and waste management. The programme concluded with a valedictory session, where participants reflected on their key learnings, shared insights, and outlined strategies for implementing innovative solutions in their respective states. The participants also actively engaged in a Shram Daan activity under the Government of India’s Swachhotsav initiative. Joining hands with faculty and peers, senior officials contributed to cleaning and beautifying the vicinity of the IIM Indore campus. This hands-on exercise reinforced the programme’s philosophy of blending academic learning with practical action, allowing participants to experience the impact of collective effort in promoting cleanliness, hygiene, and community-driven civic responsibility. Through ANVESHAN, IIM Indore continues to bridge academic insights with real-world urban governance practices, nurturing leaders who are ready to contribute meaningfully to the Swachh Bharat Mission (Urban) 2.0 and champion a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable India. title: Hindi Diwas Celebrated at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: Hindi Diwas Celebrated at IIM Indore – IIM Indore Hindi Diwas Celebrated at IIM Indore Home News And Events Hindi Diwas Celebrated at IIM Indore navigate to Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) celebrated Hindi Diwas under the Hindi Fortnight with great enthusiasm. The event was inaugurated by the Institute’s Director, Prof. Himanshu Rai, and witnessed the presence of distinguished Hindi language experts who shared their insights on the language’s rich tradition, contemporary relevance, and future possibilities. In his inaugural address, Prof. Rai emphasized IIM Indore’s commitment to promoting Indian languages, particularly Hindi. He said that while a country is shaped by its population and demography, it is culture that builds a nation and gives it its true identity, and at the heart of this culture lies language. Quoting scriptures, he noted that language has been accorded the status of a mother. Just as a mother nurtures and sustains life, language preserves and strengthens civilization. He emphasized that Hindi should be embraced with pride rather than hesitation, as education in one’s mother tongue accelerates knowledge and understanding. Prof. Rai urged everyone to pledge to protect and preserve Indian languages. The highlight of the event was the panel discussion on the theme “Hindi Journalism: Challenges and Opportunities.” The panel comprised Shri Nitishwar Kumar, IAS, Additional Secretary, Government of India; Shri Jai Prakash Pandey, Editor of Sahitya Tak and Sahitya Aajtak at the TV Today/India Today Group; and Prof. (Dr.) Vartika Nanda, Head of the Journalism Department at Lady Shri Ram College, University of Delhi. The discussion was moderated by Prof. Rai. Shri Jai Prakash Pandey stated that the greatest strength of Hindi journalism today lies in social media, which has provided every segment of society the opportunity to express themselves. He noted that Hindi, supported by other Indian languages, is reaching a wider audience through translations and digital platforms. While the government has made efforts to promote Hindi, he emphasized that the real test lies in how widely the language is actually used. Simplification is necessary for clarity of communication, he added, but it must be done without compromising the richness of the language. Shri Nitishwar Kumar highlighted the scientific foundation and cultural depth of Hindi. He explained that the Hindi alphabets and letters are deeply connected to life and culture, and that knowledge of Sanskrit makes learning other languages easier. He described Hindi’s role through literature and cinema as instrumental in shaping national identity, and noted that Hindi has absorbed influences from many civilizations, thereby enriching itself. Prof. Vartika Nanda emphasized that the true strength of Hindi lies in the people of India, and the ones who speak Hindi. Once considered secondary to foreign languages, Hindi has proven itself over time and created new opportunities. She said that simplification is not always necessary, and that richness matters more. She expressed concern over careless mixing of languages, and stated that Hindi’s real power lies in preserving its dignity and cultural honor. On this occasion, the tenth issue of the Institute’s Hindi magazine Gyaan Shikhar was released by the esteemed guests. The issue featured research articles, poems, essays, and creative expressions by members of the IIM Indore community, and was widely appreciated by all present. Winners of the various competitions organized under the Hindi Fortnight were also felicitated at the event. These competitions provided students and staff with an opportunity to showcase their talent in Hindi writing, debates, and poetry recitation. The Rajbhasha Department also presented a review of the use of Hindi at the Institute and suggested measures for further increasing its application in the future. The entire event created an atmosphere filled with pride for the Hindi language and its vitality. The panel discussion gave the audience a deeper understanding of the challenges and opportunities facing Hindi journalism. Previous Next

title: IIM Indore Welcomes the Newest Cohort at the Induction Programme for IPM Batch 2025–30 – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Welcomes the Newest Cohort at the Induction Programme for IPM Batch 2025–30 – IIM Indore IIM Indore Welcomes the Newest Cohort at the Induction Programme for IPM Batch 2025–30 Home News And Events IIM Indore Welcomes the Newest Cohort at the Induction Programme for IPM Batch 2025–30 navigate to Five international students join the batch from the UK, the USA, and Australia The Indian Institute of Management Indore warmly welcomed its newest cohort into the prestigious Five-Year Integrated Programme in Management (IPM) at the Induction Ceremony for the IPM Batch 2025–30, held on August 6, 2025. The event marked the beginning of a transformative academic journey for 156 bright, young minds. The ceremony was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, who addressed the incoming batch with a heartfelt welcome and insightful reflections. Drawing on his rich personal and professional experiences, Prof. Rai set the tone for the rigorous and meaningful journey ahead. “True education begins with the recognition of our own ignorance,” he said. “At IIM Indore, we encourage you to cultivate a mindset of curiosity, humility, and self-awareness. Don’t chase perfection; instead, strive for progress, and learn to navigate your path with purpose and empathy.” He also urged students to schedule priorities rather than prioritize schedules. “There will always be more to do than time permits,” he noted. “What matters is clarity and knowing what’s urgent, what’s important, and what can wait.” Prof. Rai concluded by encouraging students to embrace empathy, both for themselves and for others, as a guiding principle in their personal and professional lives. Prof. Rai encouraged the new batch to take ownership of their learning experience, reminding them that growth often lies beyond one’s comfort zone. “Over the next five years, you will be pushed, questioned, and challenged—but also empowered, supported, and celebrated,” he added. “Use this platform to explore, build, and lead.” Prof. Aditya Maheshwari, Chair – IPM, extended a warm welcome to the incoming class and reflected on the pioneering spirit of the IPM programme, which has become one of India’s most sought-after undergraduate management courses. He noted that the batch includes students from diverse academic backgrounds, ranging from commerce and science to humanities and the arts, reflecting the interdisciplinary nature of the programme. He also shared that the IPM journey is a unique opportunity to develop not just as professionals, but as socially conscious leaders. “Our aim is to help you integrate knowledge across domains and apply it to solve real-world challenges, whether through startups, research, or impactful social initiatives”, he said. As part of the event, IIM Indore also hosted the Certificate of Academic Excellence ceremony, recognizing students from previous IPM batches for outstanding academic performance. The Late Adya Prabha Memorial Scholarship was also announced to honor excellence and perseverance in academic pursuits. This year, the scholarship was awarded to Piyoni Jayesh Shethia from the IPM 2021 – 26 batch, who achieved the highest CGPA in the fourth year of the programme. The scholarship commemorates the legacy of Late Adya Prabha, a bright and promising student from the IPM 2015 batch whose memory continues to inspire academic dedication and integrity. The IPM 2025–30 batch at IIM Indore reflects a rich tapestry of diversity in academic backgrounds, gender, geography, and global representation. With 156 students, including 151 domestic and 5 international candidates, the cohort brings together perspectives from across India and abroad. The batch comprises of 57 females and 99 male participants, and showcases a healthy mix: 72 students come from a Commerce background, followed closely by 67 from Science (PCM), while others represent disciplines like Humanities, PCB, and interdisciplinary fields. This interdisciplinary blend supports the IPM programme’s vision of nurturing versatile and well-rounded leaders. Geographically, the batch represents over 20 states and union territories, with the highest representation from Maharashtra (26), Uttar Pradesh (18), Madhya Pradesh (16), West Bengal (13), and Delhi (11). This pan-India diversity ensures a vibrant classroom experience, enriched by varied linguistic, cultural, and socio-economic backgrounds. As the new cohort embarks on its five-year journey, the induction programme serves as a powerful reminder of the values that define IIM Indore – excellence, empathy, innovation, and integrity. The road ahead promises not just academic milestones but also the shaping of future leaders equipped to make meaningful contributions to society and the world. Previous Next

title: 23rd Batch of PGPMX Begins at IIM Indore Mumbai Campus – IIM Indore
content: 23rd Batch of PGPMX Begins at IIM Indore Mumbai Campus – IIM Indore 23rd Batch of PGPMX Begins at IIM Indore Mumbai Campus Home News And Events 23rd Batch of PGPMX Begins at IIM Indore Mumbai Campus navigate to 24 Participants Begin a Transformative Journey in Executive Management Education The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) marked another milestone in executive learning with the inauguration of the 23 rd batch of its weekend MBA, the Post Graduate Programme for Working Executives in Mumbai (PGPMX 2025–27) at its Mumbai Campus on August 02, 2025. The batch was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore. Prof. Mit Vachhrajani, Chair – PGPMX, faculty members, and all the registered 24 participants were also present on this occasion. Prof. Himanshu Rai, in his inaugural address, urged participants to approach the programme with an open heart and mind, emphasizing that learning comes from every interaction, be it with faculty, peers, or alumni. He encouraged the cohort to develop conscientiousness, practice discipline, and manage time wisely. “The key,” he said, “is to focus only on what you truly want to do. Spend time on things that genuinely matter to you, because when you follow your passion, your habits shape your character.” He reminded participants to have empathy not just for others, but for themselves. “Be kind to yourself,” he said. “Don’t judge or compare. You are on your own journey, so don’t live your life chasing someone else’s expectations. Even if you succeed, it won’t bring fulfillment if it’s not truly yours.” He further encouraged the batch to live courageously, to let go of the fear of failure, and to remember that while hard work is necessary, it is not sufficient. What truly drives success, he noted, is grit, patience, and resilience. He also stressed the importance of networking and building relationships across diverse perspectives, urging participants to connect not just with those from similar backgrounds but also with those who are different. This inclusive mindset, he said, is what shapes empathetic, adaptable, and impactful leaders. In his welcome address, Prof. Mit Vachhrajani congratulated the participants on taking a decisive step toward leadership and growth. He highlighted the unique structure of the PGPMX, which enables professionals to work and study concurrently, with alternate weekend classes designed to ensure immediate application of classroom learning in real-world scenarios. “This simultaneous learning and implementation model provides a deep, experiential learning curve,” he noted. With IIM Indore’s participant-centred pedagogy, peer learning is the true strength. Over two years, participants reflect, evolve, and emerge as stronger leaders, professionals, and responsible citizens, he said. The batch comprises 24 accomplished professionals bringing together a rich mix of experience across diverse domains such as banking and financial services, pharmaceuticals, consulting, information technology, manufacturing, telecommunications, engineering services, education, media and entertainment, infrastructure, consumer goods, public sector, and sports administration. With an average age of 35 years and an average work experience of 10.81 years, the batch includes professionals holding designations like AVP, General Manager, Senior Manager, Deputy Manager, Technical Lead, Project Manager, Consultant, Assistant Manager, Lead Engineer, Senior Associate, Engineer, and Operations Coordinator, among others. The cohort is geographically diverse and represents states such as Maharashtra, Delhi, Gujarat, Chandigarh, and West Bengal. This blend of functional expertise, academic backgrounds, and industry sectors sets the foundation for robust peer learning and multidimensional classroom discussions. Previous Next

title: New Batch of EDPM and EDPMG Begins at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: New Batch of EDPM and EDPMG Begins at IIM Indore – IIM Indore New Batch of EDPM and EDPMG Begins at IIM Indore Home News And Events New Batch of EDPM and EDPMG Begins at IIM Indore navigate to IIM Indore Welcomes New Batches of Executive Doctoral Programmes, Reinforcing Its Vision of Creating Impactful Scholar-Leaders Continuing its legacy of academic excellence and social impact, the Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) inaugurated the 15th batch of its Executive Doctoral Programme in Management (EDPM) and the 5th batch of the Executive Doctoral Programme in Management & Governance (EDPMG) on July 14, 2025. The ceremony marked another milestone in IIM Indore’s mission to develop socially conscious, research-driven leaders who can drive transformative change in business, government, and society. The batches were inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore. Chief Guest Dr. Uttiyo Raychaudhury, Vice Provost, University of Denver, USA, and Prof. Rajhans Mishra, Chair – Doctoral Programme in Management (DPM), were also present on this occasion. In his address, Prof. Himanshu Rai highlighted several key initiatives by IIM Indore aimed at addressing real-life challenges such as inequality, the rural-urban divide, and environmental degradation. He emphasized that the institute’s mission goes beyond academics and strives to be a driving force for national development. Inviting scholars to contribute meaningfully, he stressed that becoming a Viksit Bharat by 2047 requires building robust systems and solving governance challenges. “At IIM Indore, we are committed to nurturing leaders who blend knowledge with compassion and research with purpose. Our executive doctoral programmes are designed for professionals who aspire to solve real-world problems through cutting-edge scholarship,” he noted. He shared his aspiration to nurture not just warrior scholars but “scholar warriors” who can both develop and defend the nation intellectually. “Bring three essential qualities to their research journey: a deep hunger for knowledge, humility, and curiosity; integrity in both thought and action; and the temperament to stay engaged”, he said. He encouraged the participants to choose topics that excite them, add value to others, and lead to meaningful learning. “When all three align, you know you’re on the right path,” he concluded. In his inaugural address, Dr. Uttiyo Raychaudhury expressed delight at visiting IIM Indore, praising it as an inspiring institution that is transforming the higher education landscape. He lauded IIM Indore’s remarkable progress under the leadership of Prof. Himanshu Rai. He noted that this journey marks a new chapter co-authored by the participants and the institute. Unlike earlier phases of education pursued out of necessity, he emphasized that this phase is driven by passion and choice. True success, he said, requires not just competence but a “multiplier attitude”- the mindset that brought participants here.  He urged scholars to be bold, embrace failure as part of learning, and bring innovation and curiosity into their research. “You are the author of your story, so write it with openness, creativity, and a commitment to impact,” he concluded, encouraging collaboration and purpose. Prof. Rajhans Mishra highlighted IIM Indore’s journey of progress and innovation, noting that it was the first IIM to launch the EDPMG programme. “You, as participants contribute this course, as you bring real-world problems into academic spaces, find solutions, and take them back to your sectors,” he noted. He also stressed the importance of addressing governance-related challenges through rigorous exploration. Prof. Mishra urged the scholars to approach the journey with an open mind and a deep commitment to learning. The 2025 intake includes 24 participants (18 in EDPM and 6 in EDPMG), representing a rich blend of backgrounds including engineering, finance, technology, social sciences, and urban governance. The diversity of the cohort underscores the growing appeal of IIM Indore’s executive research programmes among high-achieving professionals. title: New Batch (2025) Begins at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: New Batch (2025) Begins at IIM Indore – IIM Indore New Batch (2025) Begins at IIM Indore Home News And Events New Batch (2025) Begins at IIM Indore navigate to Record-Breaking Female Representation in PGP and PGP-HRM as IIM Indore Welcomes New Batches – For the first time ever, women outnumber men in the flagship PGP; PGP-HRM sees a 100% female cohort IIM Indore officially welcomed its new batches for the academic year 2025–26, inducting a total of 650 participants across the Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP), Post Graduate Programme in Human Resource Management (PGP-HRM), Integrated Programme in Management – Fourth Year (IPM-IV), and the Doctoral Programme in Management (DPM). The batch was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, and graced by Chief Guest Lt. Gen. Harjeet Singh Sahi, Commandant, Army War College, Mhow. In his inaugural address, Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director of IIM Indore, urged the new participants to begin their journey with clarity, purpose, and empathy. He spoke about the importance of having a personal vision and being mindful of why they chose to be at IIM Indore. Emphasizing openness, he encouraged students to listen actively, embrace diverse viewpoints, and remain receptive to new ideas in the classroom. He also stressed the need for introspection, urging participants to define success on their own terms rather than conforming to external expectations. Highlighting the role of courage, Prof. Rai encouraged them to take risks and not be afraid of failure when pursuing new paths. “You are not here merely to earn a degree,” he noted, “but to discover yourselves and the difference you can make.” He concluded by underscoring the value of empathy, reminding students to care for one another and build a supportive learning community. Chief Guest Lt. Gen. Harjeet Singh Sahi addressed the incoming cohort with a compelling talk on leadership, courage, and responsibility. He highlighted that today’s operational environment demands more than technical skills; it calls for clarity of purpose, emotional intelligence, and a deep commitment to ethical conduct. Drawing from his experience in the armed forces, he spoke about the essence of military leadership: the ability to inspire and empower, to lead with empathy, and to uphold the values of integrity and service above self. He urged students to develop not just as professionals but as responsible citizens who lead by example. “True leadership,” he said, “is about taking ownership, understanding the people you lead, and having the courage to do what is right even in the face of adversity.” Lt. Gen. Sahi commended the leadership of Prof. Himanshu Rai and lauded the remarkable growth of IIM Indore. He noted that the relationship between Army War College and IIM Indore is built on shared values—discipline, commitment, and excellence—and has only grown stronger over the years. “The way IIM Indore has been shaped under Prof. Rai’s vision is truly commendable,” he remarked, expressing confidence that IIM Indore’s students would continue to contribute meaningfully to the country’s future through responsible leadership, collaboration, and continuous learning. Making history in its pursuit of equity and inclusion, IIM Indore has achieved a landmark in gender and academic diversity. Women now constitute 53.79% of the Post Graduate Programme (PGP) batch, marking the first-ever female-majority cohort in the institute’s flagship programme. Meanwhile, the Post Graduate Programme in Human Resource Management (PGP-HRM) has 100% female participation this year. Further highlighting the institute’s inclusive academic profile, 54.6% of PGP participants and an impressive 88.24% of PGP-HRM participants come from non-engineering backgrounds, underscoring IIM Indore’s commitment to nurturing diverse managerial talent from across disciplines. While Engineering/Technology (126) and Management-related disciplines (65) form the largest academic streams, strong representation from Commerce (54), Economics (42), and Computer Science (59) adds further diversity. In terms of geography, Maharashtra leads with 65 participants, followed by Uttar Pradesh with 63, and Delhi (48), showcasing pan-India presence. Madhya Pradesh has contributed 40 participants to the PGP 2025–27 batch, underscoring the strong representation from the institute’s home state and its continued role in shaping future management professionals. Additionally, 34.3% of the batch brings prior work experience, ensuring a balanced mix of fresh perspectives and industry insights. Similarly, the PGPHRM batch reflects remarkable academic diversity, with strong representation in Commerce (15), Management Studies (8), Economics (4), Botany (3), and Literature (3), among others, highlighting the interdisciplinary foundation of the HRM programme. In terms of work experience, 33.33% of the participants (17 students) bring prior professional exposure, adding depth and practical insight to classroom discussions, while the remaining 34 students are fresh graduates. The cohort is geographically diverse, with participants hailing from 17 states and union territories, including Uttar Pradesh (6), Delhi (6), Maharashtra (6), Assam (3), Jharkhand (3), and Telangana (3), reflecting the pan-India appeal of the programme and IIM Indore’s inclusive academic ethos. Recognizing Academic and Social Impact At the event, 31 Certificates of Academic Excellence were awarded to the top 5% of the combined PGP-I and IPM-IV batch, and two certificates were conferred upon PGP-HRM participants, celebrating their stellar academic performance. The institute also recognized student contributions to rural development through its flagship Rural Engagement Programme (REP). Further promoting equity and access to education, IIM Indore announced the Need-Based Financial Assistance (NBFA) Merit Awards for the year 2025. In the PGP-1/IPM-IV category, a financial grant of ₹10,00,000 was awarded to Ms. Archana Choudhary. In the PGP-HRM-1 category, Ms. Prisha Garg received a grant of ₹8,00,000. These awards reflect the institute’s commitment to supporting meritorious students from economically challenged backgrounds and ensuring that financial constraints do not hinder academic aspirations. The induction ceremony concluded with comprehensive briefings on academic support, digital resources, infrastructure, and campus initiatives, setting the tone for a transformational journey ahead. title: Fifteenth Edition of CERE Kick-starts at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: Fifteenth Edition of CERE Kick-starts at IIM Indore – IIM Indore Fifteenth Edition of CERE Kick-starts at IIM Indore Home News And Events Fifteenth Edition of CERE Kick-starts at IIM Indore navigate to Three-day conference explores the evolving landscape of the knowledge economy Indian Institute of Management Indore is hosting the 15th edition of its flagship International Conference on Excellence in Research and Education (CERE) from May 02-04, 2025. With the theme “Paradigm Shift in the Knowledge Economy,” this year’s conference aims to explore how digital transformation, sustainability, global disruptions, and evolving societal values are reshaping the production and application of knowledge in academia, industry, and governance. The conference was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore. He emphasized the need for a paradigm shift in how educational institutions operate in today’s evolving knowledge economy. He mentioned that institutions must reimagine their approach to research in the evolving knowledge economy. “While theoretical models are valuable, research today must aim to address real-world problems and generate actionable insights. Institutions must move beyond academic silos to create, curate, and apply knowledge in ways that are socially relevant and ethically grounded” he said. Research should not just exist in journals—it should contribute meaningfully to society and help develop leaders who can drive change with integrity. “Institutions must practice what they preach—preparing leaders who can solve real-world problems through research that goes beyond theory,” he noted. He concluded with three guiding principles: be compassionate, know your true identity beyond designations or wealth, and always do the right thing—both as researchers and as human beings. This, he said, is the path to true excellence. Welcoming the participants, Prof. Shruti Tewari, Dean – Research, highlighted the significance of CERE as a confluence of research, academic excellence, and practice. She emphasized the theme’s timeliness in light of the global shift toward innovation-led economies and interdisciplinary knowledge systems. Also present at the inaugural session were Prof. Ramadhar Singh, Distinguished University Professor, Ahmedabad University; Prof. Debjit Roy (IIM Ahmedabad), Prof. Sayantan Banerjee, Faculty, IIM Indore; and Prof. Manish Popli. The conference received an overwhelming response, with over 350 paper submissions from 640 authors nationwide. After a rigorous review process, 66 high-quality papers were selected for presentation. Participants represented more than 70 prestigious institutions from across the country, underscoring CERE’s growing reputation as a premier platform for academic exchange and interdisciplinary research. The three-day conference will also feature eight expert-led workshops covering a wide range of contemporary research areas. These workshops will be conducted by distinguished academicians, including Prof. Ramadhar Singh (Ahmedabad University), Prof. Debjit Roy (IIM Ahmedabad), Prof. Sushanta Mishra (IIM Bangalore), Prof. Lakshmi Goyal (IIM Ahmedabad), Prof. Sayantan Banerjee (IIM Indore), Prof. Devi Vijay (IIM Calcutta), Prof. Tara Shankar Shaw (IIT Bombay), and Prof. Belgin Somerville (University of Glasgow, UK). The sessions will be delving into topics such as research fundamentals, digital decision-making in supply chains, curvilinear relationships, problematization in management research, financial time series forecasting, critical research in organizing, empirical corporate governance, and navigating academic careers. Designed especially for doctoral scholars and early-career researchers, these workshops will offer hands-on learning and critical engagement with real-world challenges. CERE creates a platform for learning, sharing, and collaboration, reaffirming IIM Indore’s commitment to thought leadership, interdisciplinary dialogue, and shaping the future of management education in the knowledge-driven economy. title: IIM Indore Inaugurates the Second Batch of Master of Management Studies (MMS) Programme – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Inaugurates the Second Batch of Master of Management Studies (MMS) Programme – IIM Indore IIM Indore Inaugurates the Second Batch of Master of Management Studies (MMS) Programme Home News And Events IIM Indore Inaugurates the Second Batch of Master of Management Studies (MMS) Programme navigate to IIM Indore Inaugurates the Second Batch of Master of Management Studies (MMS) Programme ­203 participants register for the programme Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) kickstarted the second batch of its Executive Management Programme – Master of Management Studies (EMP – MMS) programme on April 21, 2025. The batch was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore. Prof. Manoj Motiani, Associate Dean – Executive Education; Prof. Nishit Kumar Sinha, Programme Coordinator, and Mr. Sridhar Nagarajachar, Business Head, Times Pro, were also present on this occasion. During his inaugural address, Prof. Rai congratulated the participants on embarking upon this transformative new journey. He encouraged them to make the most of the next two years, emphasizing that the real value of learning lies in how well it is applied and shared. Prof. Rai spoke about the essence of the MMS programme, stating that it embodies everything the industry and the country will need in the future. He urged the participants to remain open, curious, and eager to learn—not just from the curriculum, but also from the diverse experiences of their peers. “Reach out to the people and the resources we offer. Embrace the wisdom available around you, and approach each other with open hearts and minds.” He stressed the importance of communicating effectively, translating knowledge into action, and helping others grow. Highlighting the importance of resilience, Prof. Rai remarked, “Be courageous—because without courage, there is no integrity. You will face challenges, but never give up. Your strength lies in what you’ve already achieved.” Mr. Sridhar Nagarajachar, Business Head at Times Pro, extended his congratulations to the entire cohort and acknowledged the competitive process they went through to be part of this programme. He noted that this group holds immense potential to create meaningful and lasting impact. He encouraged everyone to actively engage in the case pedagogy approach, learn from peers, and cultivate relationships that will endure beyond the duration of the programme. Prof. Nishit Kumar Sinha extended a heartfelt greeting to the new cohort of participants. He emphasized the transformative nature of the MMS programme and its role in shaping the leaders of tomorrow. Prof. Sinha also highlighted the tailored curriculum designed to meet the evolving needs of working professionals in today’s dynamic business environment. The inauguration concluded with a vote of thanks by Prof. Manoj Motiani. He emphasized IIM Indore’s commitment to delivering on the promises of relevance, effectiveness, and quality. He advised the participants that the outcome of this journey will not just be shaped by what’s available, but by how committed they are to learning from everything around. This batch comprises a dynamic and diverse group of 203 participants. With 62% male and 38% female participants, the cohort represents a strong gender mix. Educational backgrounds are equally varied, with 63% from engineering, 16% from finance, followed by arts (7%), management (6%), science (6%), and IT (2%). The batch brings rich industry experience from 24 different sectors, including Information Technology, Financial Services, Sales & Marketing, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Education, Consulting, and more. Geographically, the participants hail from 17 states across India, including Karnataka, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, Delhi, and Tamil Nadu—highlighting the programme’s pan-India appeal and its relevance across regions and industries. MMS is designed for working professionals, focusing on enhancing leadership, strategic thinking, and business acumen. It covers key areas like economics, finance, strategy, and communication, using a blend of online and offline learning methods. The course offers flexibility while providing practical, real-world knowledge to help participants lead in today’s evolving business environment. The response has been highly enthusiastic, with a diverse and motivated group of professionals joining the second batch, eager to develop their skills and take on leadership roles in their organizations. IIM Indore remains committed to offering cutting-edge executive education that empowers professionals to become ethical, strategic, and forward-thinking leaders in their respective fields. title: 17th Batch of EPGP Begins at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: 17th Batch of EPGP Begins at IIM Indore – IIM Indore 17th Batch of EPGP Begins at IIM Indore Home News And Events 17th Batch of EPGP Begins at IIM Indore navigate to 17th Batch of EPGP Begins at IIM Indore – A total of 71 participants register for the one-year residential MBA programme The 17th batch of the Executive Post Graduate Programme in Management (EPGP) at IIM Indore commenced on April 03, 2025, with 71 participants joining the prestigious one-year full-time residential MBA programme. The batch was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, in the presence of Chief Guest Mr. Rajnish Sharma, Senior Director, Coca-Cola India, along with Prof. Prabin Kumar Panigrahi, Dean – Programmes, and Prof. Jatin Pandey, Chair – EPGP. Welcoming the new batch, Prof. Himanshu Rai shared profound insights on leadership, personal growth, and self-awareness. He urged the participants to develop Emotional Intelligence, Passion, Grit, and Purpose within themselves. He emphasized the need to be responsible in thoughts, speech, and actions, practicing reflective listening—not just hearing, but truly understanding, including silence in conversations. ‘Build integrity and capability from within, and ensure that you lead with both wisdom and authenticity’, he said. Speaking about passion, he explained that true passion emerges when capability is combined with motivation and self-willingness. He advised the participants to master their subjects and essential skills, as competence is the foundation of excellence. Moving on to grit, he highlighted that while hard work is necessary, it is not sufficient—what truly matters is resilience, the ability to rise after every failure, and to persist despite challenges. Finally, he spoke about purpose, urging the participants to contribute to the world they wish to live in and actively create that world for themselves. He reminded them that every batch is unique, facing different challenges and opportunities, and encouraged them to stay strong, experiment, and continuously push forward. Mr. Rajnish Sharma congratulated the participants on taking this significant step in their careers by enrolling in the EPGP programme. Drawing from his own journey, he shared personal experiences, highlighting how a learning mindset is key to growth. ‘Embrace learning in its truest sense, not just from coursework but also from the diverse experiences of your peers. Discussions in the classroom would be deeply enriching, providing insights beyond what you had learned in your respective industries’, he said. Encouraging them to connect with great minds, he urged them to reflect on their aspirations, identify their true calling, and use their knowledge and skills to serve the community with a greater purpose. Prof. Prabin Kumar Panigrahi delivered the vote of thanks. He also congratulated the participants on embarking on this transformational journey. He spoke about the rigorous and innovative curriculum that has been designed to equip them with future-ready skills, preparing them to become leaders who can navigate the complexities of the business world. Prof. Jatin Pandey, Chair – EPGP, welcomed the new batch into the IIM Indore community and reiterated the institute’s commitment to providing a learning environment that fosters intellectual growth and professional development. He encouraged the participants to take full advantage of the resources and opportunities available at IIM Indore. Notably, the Executive Post Graduate Programme in Management (EPGP) at IIM Indore has been ranked 69th globally in the Financial Times Global MBA (FT Global MBA) Rankings, reinforcing its position among the world’s premier management programmes. This recognition highlights the institute’s commitment to excellence, innovation, and leadership development on a global scale. This year’s batch, comprising 71 participants, represents a diverse mix of professionals from industries such as Automotive, BFSI, Consulting, IT/ITES, Manufacturing, Government, and more. With an average age of 32 years and an average work experience of 7.8 years, the batch brings together seasoned professionals who will contribute their expertise and perspectives to enrich classroom discussions. The participants were also given an overview of IIM Indore’s facilities, academic resources, and library services, setting the stage for an intense and rewarding year of learning, collaboration, and personal growth. title: IIM Indore Hosts its 26th Annual Convocation – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Hosts its 26th Annual Convocation – IIM Indore IIM Indore Hosts its 26th Annual Convocation Home News And Events IIM Indore Hosts its 26th Annual Convocation navigate to IIM Indore Hosts its 26th Annual Convocation The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) proudly hosted its 26th Annual Convocation today, celebrating the remarkable achievements of its graduating participants.Renowned Chess Grandmaster Mr. Viswanathan Anand graced the event as the Chief Guest and delivered the Convocation Address. This year, 788 students from seven flagship programmes were awarded their degrees, marking a significant milestone in their academic and professional journeys. In his opening remarks, Shri M M Murugappan, Chairman of the Board of Governors, IIM Indore, extended his heartfelt congratulations to the graduating batch and their families. He lauded the perseverance and dedication of the students, highlighting the role of education in shaping future leaders. Acknowledging IIM Indore’s growing stature as a premier management institute, he commended the faculty and leadership for encouraging an environment of excellence. “The world of uncertainty presents opportunities for the bold. India’s economic momentum is strong but deeply connected to global shifts. Technology is reshaping industries, making global competitiveness tougher beyond policies and geopolitics. These challenges bring immense opportunities, demanding resilience, determination, and a positive mindset. Like a Grandmaster, embrace reflection, strategic pauses, and balance”, he said. He mentioned that India needs leaders who are skilled, principled, and ethical. He said, “Let integrity and values guide your decisions, building not just success but lasting institutions. As you step into the professional world, remember that learning never stops. The real test of your knowledge lies beyond the classroom, in the choices you make and the impact you create. Leverage your education, leadership skills, and values to drive meaningful change for India and the world.” During the convocation ceremony, Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore addressed the graduating class with an inspiring message centered around GLOBE, a framework representing the core values essential for a meaningful and impactful life. He emphasized that true success is not just about reaching a destination but about building a bridge that uplifts both oneself and others. He elaborated on the five pillars—Grit, the resilience to overcome challenges; Leadership, the ability to guide and inspire; Optimism, the mindset to navigate uncertainties with confidence; Balance, the wisdom to harmonize ambition with well-being; and Excellence, the pursuit of the highest standards in all endeavors. Encouraging students to embrace these values, he stated, “The world will recognize you not just for what you achieve, but for the values you uphold and the impact you create.” He urged the graduates to remain fearless in their pursuits, adaptable in their approach, and steadfast in their commitment to making a difference. Prof. Rai also highlighted the remarkable achievements and milestones of IIM Indore over the past year, reaffirming the institute’s standing as a center of excellence. From global accreditations and prestigious rankings to groundbreaking collaborations and student accomplishments, he underscored how the institute continues to shape future leaders who drive innovation, progress, and ethical leadership. In his inspiring Convocation Address, Chess Grandmaster Mr. Viswanathan Anand shared profound insights on learning, unlearning, and the unpredictable nature of success. Drawing from his personal experiences, he emphasized that true mastery comes not just from acquiring knowledge but from continuously adapting, refining, and even discarding what no longer serves a purpose. Mr. Anand spoke about the importance of planning—how we meticulously chart out strategies, prepare ourselves to execute them, and yet, in reality, often find ourselves not using those plans at all. He highlighted that while structured preparation is essential, true success lies in the ability to pivot, rethink, and embrace new possibilities when circumstances change. He urged the graduates to remain flexible in their approach, open to change, and willing to adapt to challenges. He also delved into the concepts of success and failure, underscoring that setbacks are an integral part of any journey. Just as in chess, where a single move can change the course of the game, life, too, requires resilience and the ability to bounce back stronger. He encouraged students to view failures as stepping stones rather than obstacles, learning from each experience to refine their strategies. Additionally, Mr. Anand stressed the importance of taking breaks—not just in their careers but in their daily routines. “Rest and reflection are vital for clarity, creativity, and long-term success. Constant motion without pause can lead to burnout, while well-timed breaks allow the mind to reset and approach challenges with renewed energy”, he said. Through his words, Mr. Anand left the graduates with a powerful message: success is not about rigidly sticking to a plan but about staying agile, learning from every experience, and embracing the journey with resilience and adaptability. This year’s convocation saw 788 participants receive their degrees from the following programmes: Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP) Post Graduate Programme in Human Resource Management (PGPHRM) Five-Year Integrated Programme in Management (IPM) (including BA degree recipients) Executive Post Graduate Programme in Management (EPGP) Post Graduate Programme in Management for Working Executives (PGPMX – Mumbai) Doctoral Programme in Management (DPM) Executive Doctoral Programme in Management (EDPM) Adding to the momentous occasion, Gold Medalists were also felicitated for their outstanding academic and overall performance, symbolizing the highest level of excellence achieved by the graduating class. The 26th Annual Convocation of IIM Indore was a grand celebration of excellence, leadership, and lifelong learning, setting the stage for the graduates to embark on their future with confidence and ambition. title: IIM Indore Reaccredited by AMBA for Five Years, Strengthening Its Global Standing – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Reaccredited by AMBA for Five Years, Strengthening Its Global Standing – IIM Indore IIM Indore Reaccredited by AMBA for Five Years, Strengthening Its Global Standing Home News And Events IIM Indore Reaccredited by AMBA for Five Years, Strengthening Its Global Standing navigate to IIM Indore Reaccredited by AMBA for Five Years, Strengthening Its Global Standing All MBA Programmes of IIM Indore are now AMBA Accredited Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) is proud to announce that it has successfully received reaccreditation from the Association of MBAs (AMBA), UK, for the maximum possible period of five years. This marks the third consecutive AMBA reaccreditation, further solidifying IIM Indore’s position as a globally recognized leader in management education. IIM Indore received this coveted reaccreditation for all of its flagship MBA programmes—the Two-Year Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP), the Two-Year Post Graduate Programme in Human Resource Management (PGPHRM), the One-Year Full-Time Residential Post Graduate Programme in Management for Executives (EPGP), the Two-Year Post Graduate Programme for Working Executives in Mumbai (PGPMX), and the Five-Year Integrated Programme in Management (IPM, 4th and 5th Year). This accomplishment ensures that IIM Indore’s MBA graduates hold globally recognized degrees, backed by one of the highest benchmarks of academic quality in the world. Expressing his thoughts on this achievement, Professor Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, said, “I am pleased to share that we have successfully received our AMBA reaccreditation for the maximum possible period of five years. As we continue to climb the global rankings, this achievement will further strengthen our efforts to position IIM Indore on the world stage. This accomplishment is a testament to the dedication and collective efforts of the entire institute, working with a shared vision and commitment to our mission.” This recognition also reaffirms that our pedagogy, curriculum, and student outcomes for all of our MBA programmes are at par with the best institutions globally, he added. “We will continue to push the boundaries of excellence, ensuring that our graduates are equipped with the skills and knowledge to lead in an ever-evolving global business environment”, he said. AMBA is one of the most prestigious global accreditation bodies that assesses and certifies the highest standards of postgraduate business education. With this reaccreditation, IIM Indore continues to uphold Triple Crown accreditation, being among the few elite institutions worldwide to be accredited by AMBA (UK), AACSB (USA), and EQUIS (Europe). AMBA accreditation is awarded only to institutions that meet rigorous academic and professional benchmarks, ensuring that their MBA and management programmes are of world-class quality. Further strengthening its reputation as a socially responsible institution, IIM Indore earned recognition among the Level 5 Pioneering Schools by the UN PRME Ratings, an acknowledgment of its dedication to responsible management education and sustainability. This recognition is based on an extensive evaluation process that examines multiple aspects, including curriculum innovation, faculty expertise, student learning outcomes, industry engagement, and global impact. The accreditation committee recognized IIM Indore’s commitment to experiential learning, leadership development, and its strong focus on research-driven education. Over the years, IIM Indore has consistently worked towards strengthening its position as a global center of excellence. The institute has collaborations with 64 prestigious foreign institutions across 26 countries, providing students and faculty with opportunities for academic exchange, research partnerships, and cross-cultural exposure. These partnerships enable IIM Indore students to gain international insights and expand their learning beyond borders. The institute has also launched several international joint executive education programmes, and has increased its executive alumni count to over 900 in the UAE, Middle East and the GCC regions. IIM Indore’s reputation is further validated by its rankings and achievements on the global stage. The institute has made its mark in the Financial Times (FT) Global Rankings and QS Rankings, and has been consistently ranked among the top business schools in India. With its focus on cutting-edge research, leadership training, and real-world impact, IIM Indore continues to shape future leaders who drive business and societal progress. This reaccreditation serves as a strong affirmation of IIM Indore’s relentless pursuit of academic excellence and innovation. Moving forward, the institute remains committed to expanding its research contributions, strengthening industry collaborations, and creating a globally competitive learning environment. With AMBA, AACSB, and EQUIS accreditations, IIM Indore continues to set new benchmarks in management education, reinforcing its mission to inspire excellence, foster leadership, and drive meaningful impact in the global business ecosystem. title: GMPe Batch 16 (GCC) and Batch 17 Conclude at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: GMPe Batch 16 (GCC) and Batch 17 Conclude at IIM Indore – IIM Indore GMPe Batch 16 (GCC) and Batch 17 Conclude at IIM Indore Home News And Events GMPe Batch 16 (GCC) and Batch 17 Conclude at IIM Indore navigate to GMPe Batch 16 (GCC) and Batch 17 Conclude at IIM Indore IIM Indore and Anisuma Training Institute Celebrate Another Milestone in Executive Education IIM Indore now has 900+ alumni in the UAE and the Middle East The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) in collaboration with its education partner Anisuma Training Institute, Dubai, successfully concluded the General Management Programme for Executives (GMPe) for its 16th (GCC) and 17th batches at the IIM Indore , campus. The event marked the culmination of an intensive journey for 80 senior professionals with a valedictory function. The programmes, which ran from May 2024 to February 2025, equipped participants with advanced leadership skills, strategic acumen, and the ability to navigate the complexities of today’s global business environment. Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, highlighted IIM Indore’s expanding global footprint and its commitment to executive education in the GCC and Middle East regions. “At IIM Indore, we are not just educating professionals; we are shaping future leaders who drive impact across industries. Our executive education initiatives in the region have been growing significantly, and we are proud to see our alumni network crossing 900 members in the UAE and GCC. This growing figure reflects the value our programmes bring to working professionals and organizations alike.” He emphasized that IIM Indore is continuously evolving to meet the needs of senior executives and business leaders in an ever-changing global landscape. “We now offer a range of specialized programmes tailored for professionals in the region, including the Advanced Management Programme for Senior Leaders, the General Management Programme for Executives in Dubai, the General Management Programme for Executives for other Middle East countries, the Strategic Financial Management Programme for Executives, and the Strategic Marketing Management Programme in the Digital World for Executives. These programmes are designed to equip leaders with cutting-edge insights, strategic acumen, and the ability to drive transformation within their organizations.” Prof. Rai further noted that the increasing demand for these programmes reflects the region’s growing appetite for high-quality executive education. “The Middle East continues to be a dynamic hub for business and innovation, and we are committed to empowering professionals here with the skills and knowledge they need to lead effectively. Our vision is to continue expanding our presence, facilitating lifelong learning, and strengthening our alumni network to create a lasting impact on businesses and communities worldwide.” Dean-Faculty Prof. Ranjeet Nambudiri reinforced the idea that the GMPe is not just about earning a certificate but about transformation—professionally, personally, and academically. “Leadership is not about what you know; it’s about what you do with that knowledge. Ask yourself: after completing this programme, how do you redefine success? Is it just about profit, or is it about making a meaningful impact? Real success comes from helping people, contributing to a better world, and leading with integrity,” he said. He urged graduates to embrace innovation, lead change, and continuously push their boundaries. Prof. Manish Popli, Programme Coordinator, highlighted how the programme provided a strategic perspective and strengthened leadership capabilities. “As you return to your organizations, I encourage you to apply the knowledge gained here and remain engaged with the IIM Indore alumni network. This is a lifelong journey of learning and growth,” he noted. Dr. Mahesh Chotrani, Founder-Director, Anisuma Training Institute, expressed pride in Anisuma’s partnership with IIM Indore, emphasizing its role in creating a culture of lifelong learning. “Each batch brings together exceptional professionals, and we have seen firsthand how this programme transforms careers. He encouraged graduates to carry forward the values instilled in them and to continuously seek opportunities for growth and leadership. The GMPe at IIM Indore continues to set new benchmarks in executive education, equipping professionals with the tools they need to lead with confidence and agility. With a strong and growing alumni base in the UAE and GCC, IIM Indore, and Anisuma Training Institute remain committed to developing world-class leaders who drive meaningful change in their organizations and beyond. title: IIM Indore Conducts IRIS 2025 from February 14-16 with Grandeur and Enthusiasm – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Conducts IRIS 2025 from February 14-16 with Grandeur and Enthusiasm – IIM Indore IIM Indore Conducts IRIS 2025 from February 14-16 with Grandeur and Enthusiasm Home News And Events IIM Indore Conducts IRIS 2025 from February 14-16 with Grandeur and Enthusiasm navigate to The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) successfully hosted its flagship cultural and management fest, IRIS 2025, from February 14 to 16, 2025. This year’s theme, “Renaissance: Rise, Revive, Reignite,” embodied the fest’s vision of innovation, resilience, and renewal. Over the course of three days, IRIS 2025 featured an exciting array of business, cultural, and entertainment events, drawing participation from leading B-schools and universities across India. The fest commenced with an inauguration ceremony, graced by Colonel (Dr.) Gururaj Gopinath Pamidi (Veteran), Chief Officer Administration (COA), IIM Indore, and other distinguished guests. In his address, Col. Pamidi commended the students for their dedication in organizing this large-scale fest and highlighted how IRIS has become an integral part of IIM Indore’s culture, fostering creativity, collaboration, and experiential learning beyond the classroom. IRIS 2025 featured a diverse lineup of over 20 events that seamlessly blended business acumen, cultural excellence, and innovation. The fest hosted insightful speaker sessions, competitions, and interactive workshops, offering students a unique platform for networking, industry exposure, and skill development. One of the key highlights was a guest lecture by Mr. Sandeep Maheshwari, Executive Director of Corporate Strategy & Business Development at HPCL, who shared thought-provoking insights into India’s evolving energy sector and the future of sustainable solutions. A special session conducted by Khadi India shed light on India’s rich heritage and the importance of the “Vocal for Local” movement, emphasizing the role of entrepreneurship in empowering artisans and promoting indigenous products. The fest also featured Laavanya, a stunning fashion show presented by Reliance Trends, which saw students take the stage in a glamorous showcase of style and creativity. The business events at IRIS 2025 maintained their legacy of excellence, with premier competitions like Ashwamedha, the fest’s flagship leadership challenge, testing participants on their problem-solving, decision-making, and strategic thinking skills. Qmanji, an intense quiz competition, challenged students’ general awareness and business knowledge, while Hackwise provided a platform for tech enthusiasts to exhibit their coding prowess. Drona, a mentorship event, created an interactive space for MBA aspirants to engage with current students and gain insights into management education and career prospects. Social impact remained a core focus of IRIS 2025, with the fest featuring VIVITSA, a sustainability challenge that encouraged participants to propose innovative solutions for critical environmental issues, including WASH (Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene) and waste management. Additionally, students conducted several outreach programs and workshops for underprivileged children in rural and suburban areas, reinforcing IIM Indore’s commitment to community development and environmental awareness. Beyond business and social initiatives, IRIS 2025 delivered a spectacular cultural and entertainment experience. The fest captivated audiences with a Sufi Night with Vishad Pradhan, mesmerizing attendees with soulful performances. A stand-up comedy night with Kumar Varun infused the fest with laughter, while a high-energy DJ night kept the crowd engaged. The grand finale featured a renowned Bollywood singer, LAQSHYA, who delivered an electrifying performance, ensuring a vibrant and unforgettable conclusion to the fest. With its seamless execution of diverse, intellectually stimulating, and entertaining events, IRIS 2025 reaffirmed IIM Indore’s legacy as one of the premier college fests in India.
