title: IIM Indore Leaps 20 Ranks and Achieves #69 Rank in FT Global MBA Rankings 2025 – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Leaps 20 Ranks and Achieves #69 Rank in FT Global MBA Rankings 2025 – IIM Indore IIM Indore Leaps 20 Ranks and Achieves #69 Rank in FT Global MBA Rankings 2025 Home News And Events IIM Indore Leaps 20 Ranks and Achieves #69 Rank in FT Global MBA Rankings 2025 navigate to – Up from #89 in 2023 to #69 in 2025 – IIM Indore ranked #4 among the IIMs The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) has made a remarkable leap in the Financial Times Rankings, advancing from #89 to #69, reaffirming its commitment to excellence and global recognition. The institute’s one-year Full-time MBA – Executive Post Graduate Programme in Management – EPGP has climbed an impressive 20 places from 2023 (Rank 89), and now stands proudly at Rank 69 globally in the FT Global MBA Rankings 2025, reaffirming its status as a powerhouse of management education. The institute has been ranked as the fourth-best among all IIMs, further solidifying its standing on both national and international fronts. IIM Indore’s Director, Prof. Himanshu Rai shared his delight on this occasion. He said, “This achievement is a reflection of our relentless pursuit of excellence, our commitment to innovation, and the trust our students, alumni, and faculty place in us. Jumping 20 ranks reflects our dedication to evolving pedagogy, world-class faculty, and the success of our alumni who continue to make an impact worldwide.” The FT Rankings 2025 feature the world’s best full-time MBA programmes, with participation from 150+ globally accredited institutions. IIM Indore’s flagship EPGP has been recognized under the Global MBA category for its stellar curriculum, outstanding faculty, and the exceptional success of its alumni. “This has been possible because of several factors”, says Prof. Rai. “We earned the Triple Crown Accreditation from EQUIS, AACSB, and AMBA – and that places us among an elite group of business schools worldwide. Our graduates are making waves across industries and geographies, with exceptional career progression and leadership positions at top organizations. Furthermore, with an increased focus on ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) initiatives, the institute has been at the forefront of responsible business education”, he says. The institute now has collaborations in 24 countries, apart from numerous partnerships in India with the educational institutes, Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh governments and administration. He mentioned that the EPGP batch comprising the largest 73 participants this year boasts a dynamic cohort, with professionals from diverse industries, bringing rich perspectives to classroom discussions. Our students also go for international immersion and get global exposure and opportunities to network and learn from their peers across the globe. “Designed to equip students with future-ready skills, IIM Indore’s pedagogy is constantly evolving to meet the needs of a rapidly changing global business environment”, he says. For IIM Indore, this leap in ranking is just the beginning. With eyes set firmly on the Top 50 in the world, IIM Indore is powering ahead with new initiatives, global partnerships, and a firm commitment to excellence. Previous Next

title: IIM Indore Re-accredited by AACSB – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Re-accredited by AACSB – IIM Indore IIM Indore Re-accredited by AACSB Home News And Events IIM Indore Re-accredited by AACSB navigate to IIM Indore Re-accredited by AACSB Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) is proud to announce that it has been reaccredited by the prestigious AACSB International accreditation agency for a period of six years, reaffirming its commitment to excellence in business education. Spearheaded by IIM Indore’s Director, Prof. Himanshu Rai, the institute earned its first AACSB accreditation in 2019. With this reaccreditation, IIM Indore continues to uphold its reputation as a globally recognized institution dedicated to shaping the future of management education. IIM Indore remains among the select institutions worldwide that meet AACSB’s rigorous standards for teaching, research, curriculum development, and student learning. Reflecting on this achievement, Prof. Rai highlighted the institute’s commitment to continuous innovation, societal impact, and academic excellence. He said, “Earning AACSB accreditation in 2019 was a significant milestone. The reaccreditation in 2025 reaffirms our relentless pursuit of excellence. It reflects our ability to evolve, stay relevant, and push boundaries in management education. I extend my gratitude to the AACSB peer review team for their valuable insights, which have helped us refine our processes further”. At IIM Indore, we dedicate ourselves to creating an ecosystem that nurtures responsible leadership, innovative thinking, and transformative education. Our journey ahead focuses on strengthening our global outreach, deepening our research impact, and making meaningful contributions to society, said Prof. Rai. IIM Indore’s standing in global and national rankings further highlights its excellence. In the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) 2024, IIM Indore secured the 8th position among management institutes in India, reaffirming its leadership in business education. On the global front, IIM Indore made a remarkable impact in the Eduniversal Rankings 2024, securing Rank #3 in Central Asia and achieving the top position in the 4 Palmes Category in India, a testament to its regional influence and academic quality. In the domain of executive education, IIM Indore demonstrated significant progress. The institute made a stellar debut in the 2024 QS Executive MBA Rankings (EMBA), with its PGPMX programme securing the 25th rank in the Asia Pacific and 3rd among IIMs, underscoring its commitment to excellence in executive MBA education. Additionally, IIM Indore made a spectacular entry into the FT Executive Education Rankings 2024, securing the 3rd rank among IIMs and 61st globally in Open Executive Education Programmes, while also ranking 3rd among IIMs and 85th globally in Customized Executive Education Programmes. Further strengthening its reputation as a socially responsible institution, IIM Indore earned recognition among the Level 5 Pioneering Schools by the UN PRME Ratings, an acknowledgment of its dedication to responsible management education and sustainability. Prof. Rai mentioned that looking ahead, IIM Indore is making substantial investments in its infrastructure, ensuring that the campus continues to provide a world-class learning environment. “With a ?509.76 crore budget, the institute is expanding its facilities to include a new academic block, state-of-the-art classrooms, faculty offices, residential spaces, and a dedicated executive education facility. True to its commitment to sustainability, this ambitious development is a net-zero project, aligning with the institute’s vision of fostering responsible and environmentally conscious leadership,” he said. Beyond infrastructure, IIM Indore continues to innovate in academic and experiential learning. The institute is enhancing its flagship Himalayan Outbound Programme (HOP) and Rural Engagement Programme (REP), expanding them to accommodate international participants. Additionally, the Executive Education Office will conduct a customized Management Development Programme for participants from the Adam Smith Business School, University of Glasgow, offering them insights into district-level administration in India. “The programme will focus on policy implementation challenges and rural governance, providing a deeper understanding of developmental issues at the grassroots level,” said Prof. Rai. IIM Indore’s commitment to nation-building remains a cornerstone of its mission. The institute actively addresses India’s most pressing challenges—such as inequality, urbanization, and environmental sustainability—through a variety of impactful initiatives. Programmes aimed at empowering women micro-entrepreneurs, as well as contributions to the government’s One District One Product (ODOP) initiative, help foster economic resilience in rural areas. Furthermore, the Centre of Excellence, ANVESHAN, has partnered with the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, Government of India, to develop solutions for waste management and urban infrastructure challenges, reinforcing IIM Indore’s role as a thought leader in sustainable development. The AACSB accreditation provides IIM Indore with a globally recognized framework that ensures continuous improvement, growing innovation, and impact. This reaccreditation not only reinforces the institute’s standing as a premier business school but also strengthens its global network, benefiting students, faculty, and the broader business community. As IIM Indore looks to the future, it remains committed to pushing the boundaries of management education, shaping ethical and visionary leaders, and making a lasting impact on the higher education landscape, both in India and globally. title: IIM Indore Celebrates 76th Republic Day – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Celebrates 76th Republic Day – IIM Indore IIM Indore Celebrates 76th Republic Day Home News And Events IIM Indore Celebrates 76th Republic Day navigate to IIM Indore Celebrates 76 th Republic Day The Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) celebrated the 76 th Republic Day with deep reverence and national pride, reflecting the spirit of unity and patriotism that defines the nation. The ceremonial flag hoisting was led by Director Prof. Himanshu Rai, who was joined by Col. Dr. Gururaj Pamidi (Veteran) and Chief Officer: Administration, marking the beginning of a day full of meaningful reflections, recognition of excellence, and renewed commitment to the values of the Indian Constitution. In his address, Prof. Rai spoke passionately about the core values enshrined in the Indian Constitution—Justice, Liberty, Equality, and Fraternity—and how they continue to guide and inspire the nation. He highlighted the significance of Justice, which is built on two vital pillars: fairness and morality. He stressed the importance of practicing justice not only in legal matters but in every aspect of our lives, whether in personal interactions, professional conduct, or in our duties as citizens. Prof. Rai encouraged the IIM Indore community to embrace justice in its most holistic sense, ensuring that it reflects in their words, actions, and thoughts. Reflecting on Liberty, Prof. Rai emphasized that freedom of speech and thought is a cornerstone of India’s democracy. He urged that liberty should always be exercised with responsibility, ensuring that it aligns with moral integrity. He also mentioned that liberty should empower individuals to act with a sense of justice, responsibility, and awareness of their duties. Further, he said that equality is a principle that must go beyond theoretical ideals and be realized in practical terms. Prof. Rai discussed how India’s Constitution provides for legal equality, but it is crucial to extend this equality to the spheres of education, employment, and social justice. He called for equal opportunities for all, irrespective of gender, background, or status, reinforcing that true equality means ensuring access to opportunities and rights for every citizen. Prof. Rai also urged that policies and actions should reflect this understanding of equality, paving the way for a society where no one is left behind. Lastly, Prof. Rai spoke about Fraternity, emphasizing that it is essential for building a strong, united nation. He pointed out that fraternity is not just about mutual respect but also about collaboration and collective responsibility. It encourages individuals and communities to work together toward common goals, overcoming differences for the greater good of society and the nation. “ It is through the spirit of fraternity that we can truly embody the ideals of our Constitution and contribute to the welfare of the nation ”, he said. A key highlight of the event was the felicitation of IIM Indore staff members, who were recognized for their outstanding performance and dedication throughout the year. These individuals, from various departments across the institute, were honored for their exceptional commitment to the institution’s growth and success. Their contributions were integral in ensuring the smooth functioning of both academic and administrative spheres. In addition, the winners of the Janjatiya Quiz, a special quiz competition organized last year to raise awareness about India’s indigenous communities, were also felicitated. The quiz, which tested participants’ knowledge about the history, culture, and contributions of India’s tribal communities, had participants from across the IIM Indore campus. The quiz winners were honored with prizes for their impressive knowledge and enthusiasm in promoting awareness about these communities, reflecting the institute’s commitment to cultural understanding and inclusivity. The Republic Day celebrations concluded with a renewed sense of responsibility, encouraging the community to recognize their rights but also embrace their duties as citizens. Previous Next

title: IIM Indore Hosts the 4-I Summit on Indigenous Innovations in Indian Industries – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Hosts the 4-I Summit on Indigenous Innovations in Indian Industries – IIM Indore IIM Indore Hosts the 4-I Summit on Indigenous Innovations in Indian Industries Home News And Events IIM Indore Hosts the 4-I Summit on Indigenous Innovations in Indian Industries navigate to IIM Indore Hosts the 4-I Summit on Indigenous Innovations in Indian Industries IIM Indore successfully organized the highly anticipated 4-I Summit on the theme “Indigenous Innovations in Indian Industries” today. Organized by the Industry Interface Office (IIO) of the institute, the summit brought together leading experts from across various sectors to discuss India’s evolving industrial landscape and its growing potential for self-reliance through homegrown innovations. The event was inaugurated by Col. Dr. Gururaj Gopinath Pamidi (Veteran), COA, IIM Indore, who set the stage with a powerful speech emphasizing the need for India to embrace indigenous solutions in an increasingly globalized world. Col. Pamidi underlined how innovation-driven industries are the key to India’s growth and called for the collaborative effort of academia and industry in fostering homegrown technologies. The inaugural address was followed by a welcome speech by Prof. Shubhabrata Basu, Chair – IIO, IIM Indore, who highlighted the summit’s significance in bringing together thought leaders from across the industrial spectrum. The summit featured a distinguished panel of speakers, each offering valuable insights into their respective industries. Commander Shantanu Bose (Retd.), Director of Shipbuilding at Garden Reach Shipbuilders & Engineers Ltd. (GRSE), shared a compelling vision of India’s maritime future. He spoke about the innovative products and projects developed by GRSE and emphasized how the shipbuilding industry is creating new opportunities for local talent and regional industries. His talk focused on the importance of a collaborative ecosystem that includes local suppliers and partners to drive innovation in shipbuilding. Mr. Mohan Savarkar, Chief Product Officer and Vice President at Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd., discussed the spillover effects of industrial innovations. He explained how competition in the automotive sector drives agility and encourages rapid adoption of cutting-edge technologies. His insights shed light on how industry-level innovation fosters an environment of continuous improvement, creating opportunities for businesses and consumers alike to benefit from more efficient, sustainable, and advanced products. Dr. Vikas Prasad, President & Managing Director of Webasto Roofsystems India Pvt. Ltd., provided an in-depth look at the evolution of sunroof systems and their impact on automotive design. Dr. Prasad showcased the advancements in energy-efficient technologies that are shaping the future of automotive interiors. His talk highlighted the role of innovation in enhancing comfort, safety, and sustainability in vehicles, as well as the growing potential of India’s automotive industry on the global stage. The event concluded with a heartfelt vote of thanks by Prof. Shubhabrata Basu, who expressed gratitude to the speakers, participants, and the IIO for coordinating the summit. Attended by the students, faculty and staff, the 4-I Summit was a day of enriching discussions and an affirmation of India’s growing role as a global hub for innovation and industrial excellence. content: Indore National Institutions Cricket Championship 2025 Kicks Off: A Historic First! – IIM Indore Indore National Institutions Cricket Championship 2025 Kicks Off: A Historic First! Home News And Events Indore National Institutions Cricket Championship 2025 Kicks Off: A Historic First! navigate to Army War College Mhow, IIM Indore, IIT Indore, Infantry School Mhow, and MCTE Mhow. For the first time ever, IIM Indore has brought together five institutions of national importance in and around Indore. The institutions have joined forces to host a thrilling cricketing event—the Indore National Institutions Cricket Championship 2025 . The participating institutions include Army War College Mhow, IIM Indore, IIT Indore, Infantry School Mhow, and MCTE Mhow . Organized and hosted by IIM Indore, this unprecedented championship brings together top academic and military institutions in a spirited celebration of sportsmanship, teamwork, and holistic well-being. The event was inaugurated by IIM Indore’s Director, Prof. Himanshu Rai. In his inaugural address, Prof. Rai highlighted the profound connection between fitness, sports, and nation-building, drawing attention to the championship’s alignment with the national Fit India Movement. He noted that the journey towards a stronger and healthier India begins at the individual level, where personal commitment to fitness can inspire a ripple effect throughout families, communities, and society at large. “ When we, as individuals, commit to staying fit—both physically and mentally—we set an example for those around us. A fit individual influences their family to embrace healthy habits, which in turn creates a healthier and more conscious society. Together, this movement grows into a powerful force that drives the nation forward, encouraging resilience, unity, and strength. A fit family leads to a fit society, and a fit society creates a robust and vibrant India ”, he said. He further emphasized that events like the Indore National Institutions Cricket Championship 2025 serve as catalysts for this transformative journey, not only by promoting physical activity but also by instilling values such as teamwork, discipline, perseverance, and collaboration. Prof. Rai said, “ The true essence of nation-building lies in small but meaningful changes—when each of us chooses to lead a healthier and more disciplined life, we collectively strengthen the foundation of a prosperous India. It begins with us, and through our efforts, we inspire change in our families, our communities, and ultimately, the entire nation. “ As part of the opening ceremony, all participating teams took a “Pledge for Holistic Fitness”, vowing to maintain a fit mind, body, and soul while committing to inspire at least one individual each month to adopt a healthier habit. This symbolic gesture underscores the tournament’s aim to promote physical and mental well-being beyond the cricket field. The matches, hosted on the scenic IIM Indore cricket ground, promise to deliver excitement and passion as students, faculty, and staff cheer for their teams. The championship culminates in a much-anticipated grand finale scheduled for February 22, 2025, where the best of the best will battle it out for glory. This historic championship sets a benchmark for future collaborations and highlights the growing role of sports in nurturing leadership, resilience, and a commitment to holistic development. title: IIM Indore Concludes the Next Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN: Centre of Excellence – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Concludes the Next Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN: Centre of Excellence – IIM Indore IIM Indore Concludes the Next Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN: Centre of Excellence Home News And Events IIM Indore Concludes the Next Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN: Centre of Excellence navigate to 39 Senior officials from 9 states participate in the four-day programme With a steadfast commitment to nation-building, IIM Indore concluded the ninth batch of its Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN, its Centre of Excellence, on January 23, 2025. This transformative initiative, in collaboration with the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA), reflects the institute’s dedication to creating a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable India under the Swachh Bharat Mission (Urban) 2.0. IIM Indore has been training senior officials from across the country, equipping them with cutting-edge knowledge and innovative tools to lead the transformation in urban governance, waste management, and sustainability. The Leadership Excellence Programme serves as a platform for empowering municipal leaders, local government officials, and industry experts to exchange ideas, share knowledge, and address the challenges of waste management and sanitation with strategic and sustainable solutions. A total of 39 senior officials from nine states, namely Karnataka, Himachal Pradesh, Jharkhand, Sikkim, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Arunachal Pradesh, Chandigarh and Kerala have participated in the programme. Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, highlighted the institute’s philosophy of nation-building through innovative education and collaboration. Reflecting on the importance of ANVESHAN’s mission, Prof. Rai said, “At IIM Indore, we are not merely teaching leadership; we are nurturing changemakers who will redefine urban India. ANVESHAN exemplifies our commitment to aligning academic excellence with national priorities. Together with MoHUA, we envision cleaner, healthier cities that lead us to a brighter future.” He outlined IIM Indore’s mission to produce socially conscious leaders and tackle some of India’s pressing challenges, including urban infrastructure. He underlined the transformative role of education and awareness, explaining that true education liberates individuals from the mindset of shirking responsibility, making it the most powerful tool for change. He praised Indore’s success, achieved through janbhagidari (community participation) and positive reinforcement, setting an example for a clean and healthy India. “You, as leaders, have the power to shape a nation’s future,” he stated, urging participants to embody this mission of clean India through education, awareness, and community-driven change. Prof. Subin Sudhir, Associate Dean – Executive Education Programme, emphasized IIM Indore’s commitment to nation-building and contributing to Swachh Bharat through ANVESHAN. He encouraged open discussions, urging participants to collaborate and learn from peers across various states, making the most of this transformative experience. Prof. Ganesh Kumar Nidugala mentioned that the programme offers an action-packed curriculum designed to address some of the most pressing urban governance challenges. He said that over the course of four days, participants got a chance to engage with industry leaders, seasoned academicians, and policymakers, delving deep into topics such as waste management, public procurement, behavioral change, and project management. A defining feature of the programme was the hands-on exposure visit to the Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC), a model of excellence in urban governance. Participants observed firsthand the best practices that had made Indore India’s cleanest city for seven consecutive years. This visit included detailed discussions with IMC leadership and other key personnel involved in Indore’s waste management and sanitation success stories. The programme featured an exceptional lineup of experts who shared their knowledge on various critical aspects of waste management. Topics included integrated solid waste management, offering holistic approaches that combined innovative practices with practical solutions; recent advancements in renewable energy, focusing on biogas and compressed biogas models; legacy waste and remediating landfills. Frameworks linking waste management to broader climate goals and strategies to influence public behavior and foster community-driven waste reduction initiatives were also discussed. Sessions on optimizing dry waste management, plastic waste management, and Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR), ways to improve door-to-door waste collection systems, and advanced waste management techniques were shared with the participants. Throughout the programme, officials gained practical insights into managing waste more effectively, integrating sustainable solutions, and driving public engagement in waste reduction. Recognizing the importance of holistic leadership, the programme also included daily yoga sessions to boost mindfulness and well-being among participants. In partnership with MoHUA and under the Swachh Bharat Mission (Urban) 2.0, IIM Indore’s Centre of Excellence ANVESHAN continues to bridge the gap between academic insights and real-world applications. Through effective collaborations, enhancing capabilities, and instilling a spirit of innovation, ANVESHAN is creating a cadre of leaders dedicated to building a cleaner, greener, and more sustainable India. title: IIM Indore Expands Global Footprint: Signs MoUs with Linnaeus University, Sweden, and National Sun Yat-sen University, Taiwan – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Expands Global Footprint: Signs MoUs with Linnaeus University, Sweden, and National Sun Yat-sen University, Taiwan – IIM Indore IIM Indore Expands Global Footprint: Signs MoUs with Linnaeus University, Sweden, and National Sun Yat-sen University, Taiwan Home News And Events IIM Indore Expands Global Footprint: Signs MoUs with Linnaeus University, Sweden, and National Sun Yat-sen University, Taiwan navigate to With an objective to strengthen its global presence and provide unparalleled opportunities for its students and faculty, the Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) has signed two significant Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) with prestigious international institutions: Linnaeus University, Sweden, and the College of Management, National Sun Yat-sen University (NSYSU), Taiwan. These partnerships signal IIM Indore’s commitment to becoming a global hub for education and research, while simultaneously enabling international institutions to gain insights into the fast-growing Indian economy and its rich cultural heritage. The first MoU was signed by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, and Prof. Susanne Ackum, Dean of the School of Business & Economics, Linnaeus University. This is the first MoU of IIM Indore in Sweden. The second MoU was signed by Prof. Rai and Prof. Shu-Chuan Jennifer Yeh, Dean of the College of Management at NSYSU. The two MoUs are founded on a shared vision of advancing academic excellence and mutual growth. Prof. Rai expressed his enthusiasm for these partnerships, stating, “At IIM Indore, we are committed to expanding our global footprint and creating opportunities that transcend borders. Our collaborations with Linnaeus University and NSYSU reflect our dedication to providing students and faculty with exposure to diverse perspectives, cutting-edge research, and innovative learning experiences. Linnaeus University, located in Sweden, is renowned for its strong focus on entrepreneurship, sustainability, and global engagement, with students and faculty from over 80 countries. “This partnership will provide our students and faculty with unique insights into Sweden’s innovation-driven economy, sustainable business practices, and an international academic environment. Together, we will explore solutions to global challenges encourage entrepreneurial thinking”, he said. NSYSU, based in Taiwan, is a highly regarded research-oriented institution celebrated for its programmes in business, management, and innovation. Prof. Rai said that with its strong foothold in technology and its global reputation for excellence in business education, this partnership will open doors for IIM Indore to engage in cutting-edge research, exchange ideas on technological advancements, and explore the dynamic Asian business ecosystem. Both agreements aim to facilitate student and faculty exchange programmes, providing opportunities for cross-cultural learning and global exposure. They also emphasize collaboration on joint research projects in areas of common interest, enabling institutions to address pressing global challenges together. Additionally, the partnerships will involve hosting joint academic events such as conferences, symposia, and workshops, creating platforms for meaningful dialogue and the exchange of ideas. By sharing research and educational resources, the institutions aim to enhance the learning experience and drive innovation. Furthermore, the exploration of joint academic programs underscores their commitment to developing impactful educational initiatives that prepare students for a globally connected world. Prof. Susanne Ackum, Dean of the School of Business & Economics at Linnaeus University, expressed her enthusiasm for the collaboration. She stated, “This MoU reflects our commitment to strengthening our international collaborations to address global challenges. Sweden and India share a spirit of innovation and entrepreneurship, and partnering with IIM Indore, a Triple Crown B-School ranked among the top business schools in the world, is an incredible opportunity. With its reputation for academic excellence , IIM Indore offers the perfect platform for creating transformative opportunities for students and faculty alike.” Linnaeus University will benefit from insights into India’s dynamic and rapidly growing economy, offering Swedish students and faculty an opportunity to engage with one of the most vibrant markets in the world. Similarly, Prof. Shu-Chuan Jennifer Yeh, Dean of the College of Management at NSYSU, emphasized the significance of the India-Taiwan connection, noting, “Taiwan and India are emerging leaders in technology, innovation, and business. Partnering with IIM Indore, a globally recognized institution ranked third in Central Asia in Eduniversal rankings Eduniversal Rankings and a commitment to impactful education, will allow us to explore synergies and drive innovation. This collaboration brings together two academic communities that are dedicated to excellence, offering immense value through joint research and educational initiatives.” Expanding its global network, IIM Indore remains focused on its mission to be contextually relevant and create socially conscious leaders in management education. These collaborations with Linnaeus University and NSYSU are a step forward in achieving that vision, bringing together the best of India, Sweden, and Taiwan to create a brighter, globally connected future. title: IIM Indore Sponsors Faculty Development Programme for Faculty and Research Scholars from Nagaland – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Sponsors Faculty Development Programme for Faculty and Research Scholars from Nagaland – IIM Indore IIM Indore Sponsors Faculty Development Programme for Faculty and Research Scholars from Nagaland Home News And Events IIM Indore Sponsors Faculty Development Programme for Faculty and Research Scholars from Nagaland navigate to 21 Participants register for the five-day programme to engaged in a fully supported learning experience as a part of IIM Indore’s Institute Social Responsibility. 21 Participants register for the 5-day program to engaged in a fully supported learning experience as a part of IIM Indore’s Institute Social Responsibility. As a premier institution committed to nation-building through education, the Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) has once again stepped forward to contribute to nation-building and create synergies across regions. IIM Indore is hosting a Faculty Development Programme exclusively designed for faculty and research scholars from Nagaland for the first time. This initiative marks a pivotal step in nurturing academic excellence and strengthening the educational framework of the Northeast. A total of 21 faculty and research scholars from Nagaland University and Kohima Science College have registered for the programme.In line with its institutional social responsibility, IIM Indore is ensuring that the participants from Nagaland have full access to the resources and learning opportunities provided throughout this programme, with no associated costs. The five-day programme was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director of IIM Indore. In his inaugural address, Prof. Rai emphasized the vital role that education plays in uniting diverse cultures and empowering individuals. He remarked, “At IIM Indore, we believe that education is not just a tool but a responsibility to build bridges, spark innovation, and create leaders. The Northeast is a region brimming with talent and untapped potential, and we are privileged to play a part in nurturing its academic future. This programme is not just about teaching; it’s about sharing, learning, and growing together as a nation.” He mentioned that the FDP reflects IIM Indore’s commitment to empowering educators and scholars to create meaningful change. He also highlighted IIM Indore’s initiatives that aim to contribute to solving problems like inequality, gap between urban and rural India, environmental issues and lack of entrepreneurial spirit in the country. Prof. Rai called on educators to inspire youth to take risks, embrace experimentation, and pursue ventures they dream of. “If we don’t celebrate failures, we won’t be able to create a culture of innovation or see the rise of big startups from India. It starts with us as mentors,” he remarked. He concluded by affirming that this programme is a two-way journey of learning. “It’s not just about teaching but about exchanging ideas and working together to create solutions for a better India” , he said. As the programme unfolds, it serves as a reminder of the power of education to connect hearts and minds across India, turning diversity into strength and challenges into opportunities. Dr. Temjenwabang, Principal of Kohima Science College, expressed deep gratitude and appreciation for Prof. Himanshu Rai’s leadership. “This FDP is a reflection of Prof. Rai’s vision and dedication to helping Nagaland progress academically and socially. The overwhelming response from our institution reflects how significant this opportunity is for us,” Dr. Temjenwabang said. He expressed his gratitude for IIM Indore’s generous support in facilitating this programme, ensuring that the participants from Nagaland are able to fully engage in this valuable learning experience without any financial concerns. He also touched on the challenges faced by educational institutions in Nagaland. “While we are working hard to advance ourselves, we have our own set of challenges, especially with conducting skill-based programmes. We face difficulties in implementing such initiatives due to limited resources. We thank IIM Indore for conducting this programme that will offer us insights on leadership, marketing research, digital marketing, finance for non-finance executives, and various case studies and simulations, that would be a game-changer for our colleges and universities.” Prof. Subin Sudhir, Associate Dean – Executive Education at IIM Indore, extended a heartfelt welcome to the participants, emphasizing the significance of the programme as a platform for growth and collaboration. Addressing the gathering, he said, “We are delighted to welcome our esteemed faculty and research scholars from Nagaland to the vibrant campus of IIM Indore. This programme is not just about academic sessions; it’s about creating a culture of knowledge-sharing and mutual learning. The Northeast holds immense promise, and through this initiative, we aim to provide tools and insights that will help enhance teaching methodologies, research skills, and leadership capabilities.” Prof. Rajhans Mishra, Programme Coordinator, delivered a vote of thanks and shared thoughtful insights on the significance of the Faculty Development Programme. He expressed gratitude to the participants and acknowledged the efforts of everyone involved in making the initiative possible. Speaking about the objectives of the programme, Prof. Mishra said, “These sessions are designed not just to share knowledge but to equip you with practical tools that you can take back to your classrooms and institutions. The true benefit of initiatives like this FDP lies in clearing out myths and broadening perspectives”. He encouraged the participants to have an open mindset—to learn, to grow, and to connect the dots between diverse ideas and experiences they gain during the programme. The Faculty Development Programme promises to be a transformative experience for the participants, combining rigorous academic training with collaborative knowledge sharing. Over the course of five days, participants will engage in immersive sessions on advanced teaching methods, cutting-edge research practices, and leadership development tailored to the unique challenges of the Northeast. This initiative is a step towards building stronger academic foundations for the region. By equipping educators and scholars with modern tools and insights, IIM Indore aims to contribute meaningfully to the larger goal of nation-building. Previous Next

title: Eighth Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme for ANVESHAN Concludes at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: Eighth Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme for ANVESHAN Concludes at IIM Indore – IIM Indore Eighth Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme for ANVESHAN Concludes at IIM Indore Home News And Events Eighth Batch of Leadership Excellence Programme for ANVESHAN Concludes at IIM Indore navigate to A total of 29 officials from 1 0 states and Union Territory of Ladakh register for the programme The eighth batch of the Leadership Excellence Programme for “ANVESHAN” (Centre of Excellence) at the Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) concluded successfully on Thursday, January 09, 2025. The four-day programme, designed to build capacity among senior municipal officials, witnessed the participation of officials from ten states, namely, Andhra Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Haryana, Karnataka, Kerala, Rajasthan, and Maharashtra, along with the Union Territory, Ladakh. These officials covered critical aspects of sustainable urban governance and waste management. In his inaugural address, Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director of IIM Indore, warmly welcomed the participants to the institute and the city of Indore, the cleanest city in India. He emphasized IIM Indore’s commitment to nation-building through transformative education, aligning with the nation’s priorities like the Swachh Bharat Mission. Prof. Rai highlighted ANVESHAN’s role in bridging academic research and practical waste management solutions. He encouraged participants to embrace their leadership roles in reshaping urban India, stressing the importance of combining knowledge with action, strategy with compassion, and innovation with sustainability. “Leadership is not just about managing change, but about inspiring it. Through knowledge, innovation, and collaboration, we have the power to transform our cities and build a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable future for all”, he said. He concluded by wishing participants an enriching journey ahead. Dean-Programmes, Prof. Prashant Salwan, spoke on the transformative potential of digital technologies in public sector governance, emphasizing how they reshape the way public organizations serve citizens and interact with them. He highlighted that while digital technologies play a key role in service delivery, the shift in focus also requires organizational and institutional changes. “Public value theory is pivotal in guiding this transformation,” he said, “by ensuring that public administration goes beyond just administrative efficiency and instead focuses on fulfilling public expectations and societal goals”. Reflecting on the evolution of the programme, Programme Coordinator Prof. Shruti Tewari highlighted its focus on peer learning and its role in strengthening the Clean India initiative. She noted that every city brings unique challenges and opportunities, and with a collaborative environment, ANVESHAN helps municipal leaders identify tailored solutions that align with their local contexts. The four-day programme featured a diverse mix of classroom sessions, field visits, and interactive discussions aimed at equipping participants with practical insights and strategies for sustainable urban development. The programme also incorporated daily Yoga sessions, starting each day with physical and mental well-being practices During their stay at IIM Indore, participants visited the Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC), widely recognized as a national leader in waste management and cleanliness. The exposure visit allowed participants to witness first-hand the innovative practices and community-driven initiatives that have earned Indore the title of India’s cleanest city for several years. They also got a chance to interact with IMC Commissioner Mr. Shivam Verma, who shared Indore’s journey toward building a sustainable waste management ecosystem. The programme offered a comprehensive curriculum designed to equip municipal leaders with the skills to drive sustainable urban governance and waste management. Prof. Amit Kumar Vatsa, IIM Indore, led the session on Integrated Solid Waste Management, followed by Prof. Shruti Tewari, IIM Indore, who conducted the “My City Perspective: Strength Analysis Activity.” The programme also featured sessions on public procurement and contract management by Prof. Bhavin Shah, IIM Indore, and Dr. Himanshu Chaturvedi, Technical Director, KPMG. Shri J.B. Ravinder, Joint Advisor (Retd.), MoHUA, and Ms. Divya Sinha, CPCB, focused on optimizing dry waste management, while Prof. Gangagni Rao, Chief Scientist, CSIR IICT, Hyderabad, addressed recent trends in renewable energy and biogas models. Shri Harendra Narayan, IAS, Municipal Commissioner, Bhopal, discussed SLF and legacy waste remediation, and Prof. Hasmukh Gajjar, IIM Indore, delivered a session on Project Management. City perspectives were shared by Shri Dr. Kailash Shinde, IAS, Municipal Commissioner, Navi Mumbai, and Shri Inderjit Singh, IAS, Municipal Commissioner, Lucknow. Mr. Jai Kumar, Senior Advisor (Climate Change and Circular Economy), GIZ, spoke about climate change and circular economy practices. Shri Akshay Kumar Rout, Former Director General of SBM & Senior Advisor, SUWASI, shared insights on behavioral change and waste reduction. The programme concluded with a panel discussion on the roadmap to SBM 2.0, moderated by Prof. Shruti Tewari, IIM Indore. In her closing remarks, Prof. Tewari emphasized the need for a unified vision to scale up the efforts of Swachh Bharat Mission 2.0. She encouraged participants to leverage what they had learned from the programme to create actionable plans for their cities. The Leadership Excellence Programme under ANVESHAN continues to serve as a vital platform for capacity building, empowering municipal leaders to create a cleaner, greener, and more inclusive urban future for India. title: IIM Indore Secures 3rd Rank in Central Asia and 1st in the 4 Palmes Category in Eduniversal Rankings 2024 – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Secures 3rd Rank in Central Asia and 1st in the 4 Palmes Category in Eduniversal Rankings 2024 – IIM Indore IIM Indore Secures 3rd Rank in Central Asia and 1st in the 4 Palmes Category in Eduniversal Rankings 2024 Home News And Events IIM Indore Secures 3rd Rank in Central Asia and 1st in the 4 Palmes Category in Eduniversal Rankings 2024 navigate to IIM Indore Secures 3rd Rank in Central Asia and 1st in the 4 Palmes Category in Eduniversal Rankings 2024 Remarkable Surge in Dean’s Vote Score from 136% to 358% Reflects Growing Global Influence and Impact Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) has achieved the 3rd rank in Central Asia and the 1st rank in the 4 Palmes of Excellence category in the Eduniversal Rankings 2024, reinforcing its standing as a leader in global business education. Furthermore, IIM Indore’s Dean’s Vote score has seen an impressive rise from 136% in 2023 to 358%, highlighting the growing recognition and influence of the institute on the global stage. The prestigious accolade was received by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, at the grand Eduniversal World Convention held in Guadalajara, Mexico, on November 21, 2024. The award, conferred during the iconic Palmes of Excellence Ceremony, recognizes institutions that demonstrate unparalleled international influence and impact in academia, leadership, and research. Among the 1,000 best business schools across 153 countries and nine geographical zones, including Africa, Central Asia, Central & Eastern Europe, Eurasia & the Middle East, Far East Asia, Latin America, North America, Oceania, and Western Europe, 74% of the deans participated in the Deans’ Vote survey, underscoring the global influence and recognition of the Eduniversal Rankings. Prof. Rai expressed pride in the institute’s achievement, stating, “Achieving the 3rd rank in Central Asia and the 1st rank in the 4 Palmes of Excellence category is a significant milestone for IIM Indore. This recognition underscores our relentless pursuit of excellence and our commitment to shaping socially responsible leaders who drive innovation and inclusivity. As we continue to build our global presence, we now set our sights on reaching the 5 Palmes category in the near future. At IIM Indore, we are committed to upholding the highest standards in business education and empowering our students with cutting-edge knowledge and skills to thrive in a dynamic world. We ensure that our students lead with purpose and contribute meaningfully to the global business landscape. “I am even more delighted to see the top three ranks in Central Asia being claimed by IIMs – IIM Bangalore, IIM Ahmedabad, and IIM Indore taking the lead. This remarkable achievement reflects the growing influence and recognition of Indian business schools on the global stage. At IIM Indore, we are proud to contribute to this legacy and continue striving for excellence in shaping the future of business education”, added Prof. Rai. The Eduniversal Palmes of Excellence Rankings assesses business schools across 153 countries based on rigorous qualitative and quantitative criteria, including accreditations, global partnerships, international collaborations, and peer recognition through the highly respected Deans’ Vote. IIM Indore’s third rank in Central Asia and first in the 4 Palmes of Excellence league is a result of its significant strides in global partnerships with 60 educational institutions across 24 countries, its Triple Crown Accreditation from three prestigious international accreditation agencies, namely EQUIS, AACSB and AMBA (making it only 1% of the B-Schools globally to have achieved this), and its outstanding efforts in tackling five critical global challenges: inequality, urbanization, rural development, environmental sustainability, and entrepreneurship. Prof. Rai emphasized, “This milestone reflects the dedication, innovation, and excellence demonstrated by our faculty, staff, participants, and alumni. It inspires us to continue pushing boundaries and contributing meaningfully to academia, industry, and society.” The Eduniversal Palmes of Excellence ranks business schools globally based on their influence and reputation. The 4 Palmes represent the top business schools with significant international influence and a strong global reputation. Below this, schools are ranked within the 3 Palmes , 2 Palmes , and 1 Palm categories, recognizing their impact on international, regional, or local levels. IIM Indore is proud to be ranked 1st in the 4 Palmes category , solidifying its position as a premier business school with a growing global presence. This achievement reflects our unwavering commitment to academic excellence, international partnerships, and shaping future leaders who drive positive change in the world. The Palmes of Excellence is evaluated against rigorous internationalization criteria developed by the Eduniversal International Scientific Committee (ISC). Composed of 11 members, including 2 Eduniversal executive members and nine independent experts with significant experience in global higher education, the ISC is responsible for the Official Selection of the Best 1,000 Business Schools worldwide and coordinates the Deans’ Vote, one of the key steps in finalizing the annual rankings. The ISC also oversees the rankings’ methodologies, performs verifications, and suggests improvements to ensure the criteria remain relevant and comprehensive. These criteria include global accreditations, consistent rankings in major global business school rankings, and active memberships in international and national academic associations. Schools are ranked within each Palme level according to the peer assessments made through the Deans’ Vote, solidifying their reputation as leaders in global business education. Previous Next

title: Bridging Borders: IIM Indore Signs MoU with Norway and China to Enhance Global Education Landscape – IIM Indore
content: Bridging Borders: IIM Indore Signs MoU with Norway and China to Enhance Global Education Landscape – IIM Indore Bridging Borders: IIM Indore Signs MoU with Norway and China to Enhance Global Education Landscape Home News And Events Bridging Borders: IIM Indore Signs MoU with Norway and China to Enhance Global Education Landscape navigate to Bridging Borders: IIM Indore Signs MoU with Norway and China to Enhance Global Education Landscape IIM Indore continues to expand its global footprint with the recent signing of Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) with Kristiania University College in Norway and Soochow University in China. These collaborations have elevat ed its network to 60 partner institutions across 24 countries. These strategic collaborations emphasize IIM Indore’s commitment to creating robust academic partnerships that offer enriched learning and research opportunities. The first MoU was signed by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, alongside Dr. Kristi Bache, Pro-rector of Research and Artistic Development at Kristiania University College. The second MoU was signed by Prof. Rai and Prof. Bo Feng, Dean of the Business School at Soochow University. Prof. Rai expressed enthusiasm about both collaborations. Signing the MoU with Soochow University, he said, “Our vision aligns closely with that of Soochow University, which is to foster innovative and responsible business leaders while integrating the concept of sustainable development into our business knowledge. This partnership not only strengthens our ties with th is esteemed institution but also enhances our ability to cultivate globally aware leaders.” Soochow University, founded in 1900, aligns with IIM Indore’s commitment to global academic excellence. The Business School of Soochow University, located in Suzhou City, Jiangsu Province, currently hosts more than 3,500 students and offers robust programmes across various fields, including Applied Economics and Business Administration, both of which are recognized as key disciplines in Jiangsu Province. The school is structured into seven departments and provides nine undergraduate programmes, alongside doctoral offerings. Prof. Bo Feng of Soochow University highlighted that their core values—Authenticity, Accountability, Appreciation, and Advancement—align well with IIM Indore’s vision of nurturing socially conscious and innovative business leaders. She noted, “Our collaboration will enhance the educational journeys of our students and faculty by creating pathways for knowledge exchange and joint research projects. Together, we aim to contribute to the high-quality development of our respective regions while addressing global challenges.” The MoU with Kristiania University College aims to promote academic exchanges and collaborative research, encouraging the exchange of faculty and students, as well as creating opportunities for joint research in areas of shared interest. Kristiania University College is one of Norway’s oldest private educational institutions, established in 1914. It offers a practice-oriented learning environment with over 16,000 students and emphasizes fields like marketing, management, creativity, and health. Prof. Rai stated, “IIM Indore’s mission to bridge academia and real-world application resonates strongly with the values held by Kristiania University College. We are eager to learn from their experiences in sustainable development and innovative practices, which will enhance our educational offerings.” He further noted that these collaborations would enrich academic experiences through knowledge sharing, participation in exhibitions, lectures, and symposia, and the exploration of joint programmes and dual degree opportunities. Dr. Kristi Bache, from Kristiania University College, expressed her excitement for the collaboration, saying, “This partnership opens exciting possibilities for both institutions. By leveraging India’s strength in technology and innovation alongside Norway’s focus on equality and high IT literacy, we can create mutual benefits that enrich our academic communities.” She emphasized that the collaboration would facilitate deeper understanding and idea exchange between the institutions. These newly signed MoUs represent a significant milestone in IIM Indore’s journey to becoming a global educational powerhouse. Through these collaborations, IIM Indore not only enhances its own educational framework but also commits to the broader vision of facilitating innovative and responsible business leadership. As the institute continues to evolve and expand its global collaborations, it remains dedicated to delivering world-class education, cultivating leaders who are prepared to navigate the complexities of an interconnected world. title: IIM Indore signs an MoU with ARTRAC; to Curate and Conduct Management Development Programme on Logistics & Supply Chain Management for Army Officers – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore signs an MoU with ARTRAC; to Curate and Conduct Management Development Programme on Logistics & Supply Chain Management for Army Officers – IIM Indore IIM Indore signs an MoU with ARTRAC; to Curate and Conduct Management Development Programme on Logistics & Supply Chain Management for Army Officers Home News And Events IIM Indore signs an MoU with ARTRAC; to Curate and Conduct Management Development Programme on Logistics & Supply Chain Management for Army Officers navigate to In a remarkable stride toward enhancing the operational capabilities of the Indian Army and contributing to the nation’s strategic preparedness, the Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) has once again demonstrated its commitment to nation-building through the power of education and leadership development. Partnering with the Army Training Command (ARTRAC), Shimla, IIM Indore has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to conduct specialized Management Development Programmes (MDPs) on Logistics and Supply Chain Management. The MoU, signed by IIM Indore’s Director, Prof. Himanshu Rai, and Air Commodore AVG Patnaik, Secretary AMSB, HQ ARTRAC, on October 22, 2024, highlights IIM Indore’s commitment to empowering military officers with strategic expertise, reinforcing the institution’s unwavering dedication to strengthening the country’s defense forces and overall nation-building efforts. Prof. Subin Sudhir, Associate Dean – Executive Education, Prof. Rayees Ahmad Sheikh from IIM Indore, and Major General MK Mathur, Col. Irdeesh Khan, Col. and Divesh Kumar were also present on this occasion. This MoU, valid for three financial years—2025-26, 2026-27, and 2027-28—demonstrates a strategic collaboration aimed at enhancing the knowledge and operational efficiency of senior officers of the Indian Army. The MDPs will be facilitated by IIM Indore’s world-class faculty and will take place under the aegis of the Army Management Studies Board (AMSB) and ARTRAC. Prof. Himanshu Rai highlighted the importance of this collaboration, stating, “At IIM Indore, we believe in shaping leaders who can respond to the complex and dynamic challenges of today’s world. Through this MoU, we are honored to contribute once again to the Indian Army’s readiness and operational excellence by imparting advanced management skills. This programme aligns with our mission of nation-building and supporting our defense forces with intellectual and professional rigor.” IIM Indore has previously collaborated with the Indian Army on various occasions, delivering impactful programmes that have contributed to strategic growth and leadership development within the army. Major General MK Mathur remarked, “The Indian Army has always been at the forefront of adapting to new strategies and technologies to maintain operational superiority. This MoU with IIM Indore will enable our officers to gain invaluable insights into modern logistics and supply chain management, ensuring that our forces remain agile, responsive, and efficient in all situations.” Air Commodore AVG Patnaik said that recognized as one of the top management institutes in India, IIM Indore’s expertise in cutting-edge management education will play a pivotal role in enhancing the strategic and logistical capabilities of the Army, helping our defense personnel stay ahead in an ever-evolving global landscape. The syllabus for the MDPs is designed to provide a comprehensive understanding of key management concepts tailored to the needs of Army officers. It spans critical areas like Supply Chain Metrics, Risk Management, Agri-based Supply Chain, and Contract Negotiations. Officers will gain insight into advanced topics such as Cold Chain Management, Reliability-Centered Maintenance, and E-Procurement. Additionally, practical exposure through case studies on Contract Management and Material Management will sharpen decision-making skills. This curriculum blends strategic theory with real-world application, ensuring participants are equipped to excel in managing complex logistics challenges. This partnership reflects the mutual vision of ARTRAC and IIM Indore to ensure that the Indian Army remains prepared to meet logistical challenges with proficiency and foresight. The programme will not only enhance the professional development of the officers but also strengthen the operational capabilities of the Indian Army by introducing contemporary management techniques that can be applied across military and civilian operations alike. With this MoU, IIM Indore and ARTRAC set a precedent for more future collaborations aimed at equipping India’s defense forces with the knowledge and skills required to excel in a rapidly evolving global landscape. title: IIM Indore’s Centre of Excellence ANVESHAN Hosts International Conference on Garbage-Free Cities – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore’s Centre of Excellence ANVESHAN Hosts International Conference on Garbage-Free Cities – IIM Indore IIM Indore’s Centre of Excellence ANVESHAN Hosts International Conference on Garbage-Free Cities Home News And Events IIM Indore’s Centre of Excellence ANVESHAN Hosts International Conference on Garbage-Free Cities navigate to IIM Indore’s Centre of Excellence on Waste Management and WASH – Water, Sanitation and Hygiene, ANVESHAN, organized an international conference titled “Towards Garbage-Free Cities: Innovations in Waste Management and Sustainability” on October 10, 2024. Organized in partnership with MoHUA, Government of India, the event gathered eminent experts, academics, and thought leaders from across the globe. It aimed to encourage a dialogue on sustainable waste management practices and promote innovative solutions for cleaner cities. The conference was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore. Prof. Rai, in his inaugural address, emphasized the importance of extending the traditional “3Rs” of waste management—Reduce, Reuse, and Recycle—to include a fourth crucial element: Refuse. He advocated that while people are often encouraged to reduce, reuse, and recycle waste, it is equally important to refuse the unnecessary use of products that contribute to waste generation. By refusing items that are not essential, we can address the root of the problem and minimize waste creation right at the source. Prof. Rai also highlighted IIM Indore’s initiatives in this area, such as promoting a zero-waste campus, implementing waste segregation, and encouraging sustainable practices across the institute, setting an example for others to follow. Speaking of ANVESHAN’s state-of-the-art facilities, Prof. Rai said that the Centre of Excellence will also support collaborations, mentorship, and training for startups and various stakeholders to drive impactful change. It will also encourage interdisciplinary research, public-private collaborations, and community-driven initiatives in waste management and the WASH (Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene) sector. “Our goal with ANVESHAN is to build a robust ecosystem that supports cutting-edge research and drives the development of solutions that are both contextually relevant and globally applicable,” stated Prof. Rai. “By connecting academia, industry, and civic bodies, we aim to make IIM Indore a pioneer in sustainability initiatives, and conferences like these will help us achieve our goal.” The conference featured a series of keynote addresses by experts from the USA, UK and Italy. Prof. Uttiyo Raychaudhuri, Vice Provost for Internationalization from the University of Denver, shared insights on “Regenerative Futures”. He emphasized the need to Rethink, Reimagine, and Rework our approach towards sustainability and waste management. He encouraged individuals to reflect on their role in the world, considering not just what they consume, but also why they consume it. Prof. Raychaudhuri stressed that with only one blue planet to protect, we need to understand the importance of doing this not just for self, but for our families, communities, and the universe at large. Drawing from his work with the Colorado National Wastewater System, he shared insights on how wastewater surveillance was instrumental in monitoring and managing public health during the pandemic, using advanced testing methods like spit and pool testing. Prof. Raychaudhuri emphasized that achieving more sustainable outcomes requires doing less—conserving resources, minimizing consumption, and adopting a balanced approach to living. Prof. Andrea Sianesi, Dean, from Politecnico di Milano, spoke on “Fashion, Design, and Luxury Urban Circularity Framework”, showcasing innovative practices in Milan aimed at integrating sustainability into the luxury sector. He emphasized the significance of integrating sustainability-driven business models into organizations, especially within the fashion, luxury, and design sectors. He pointed out that developing a circular and environmentally sustainable industrial paradigm is essential due to its wide-reaching social and economic impacts. To achieve this, education for companies and professionals is mandatory to ensure clear, shared objectives that drive meaningful change. He highlighted that by sharing best practices, the public administration and individual organizations can strengthen Lombardy and Milan’s position as global pioneers in the creation of eco-sustainable business frameworks, setting benchmarks for the broader industry. Prof. Belgin Okay-Somerville, Senior Lecturer, the University of Glasgow, explored “A Human Sustainability Approach to Waste-Free Cities”, highlighting the importance of human-centered strategies in achieving sustainable urban ecosystems. She also spoke about the importance of innovation for the common good, emphasizing the need to prioritize wellbeing and human sustainability. She noted that people tend to perform better when they are happy and feel a sense of purpose, which underscores the role of Sustainable Human Resource Management (HRM) in creating positive and productive work environments. Dr. Somerville shared insights from her extensive research conducted across 54 countries, including India, where she examined the impact of HRM practices on overall employee happiness and performance. Her message was clear: for businesses and societies to thrive, the focus must be on building systems that support both personal wellbeing and sustainable growth, ensuring that innovation benefits not just individuals, but also communities and the larger ecosystem. The conference not only addressed waste management challenges but also served as a platform for knowledge exchange and collaboration. The conference also witnessed insightful paper presentations across three key tracks—Solid Waste Management, Sustainability, and SBM 2.0 (Swachh Bharat Mission 2.0). The conference brought together researchers and experts who shared their pioneering studies and strategies for driving sustainable waste management in urban settings. Through these tracks, the conference highlighted the importance of collaborative research and strategic implementation in creating waste-free urban ecosystems, reinforcing ANVESHAN’s mission to promote sustainable development and innovation in waste management practices. The competition was incredibly fierce, with numerous thought-provoking and impactful presentations showcasing innovative solutions and research. After a rigorous evaluation process, Prathamesh Rale from IIT Indore won the Best Paper Award of Rs. 25,000/-. He has been awarded for his outstanding paper titled “Predicting Solar E-waste Trends in India: An ARIMA Approach to Sustainable Recycling Solutions.” Prof. Shruti Tewari, the Conference Convenor, highlighted the significance of building garbage-free cities and sustainable urban environments. She emphasized that the theme resonates deeply with the mission of ANVESHAN, IIM Indore’s Centre of Excellence, which was established to drive innovative research and solutions in waste management and sustainability. She shared the story of ANVESHAN’s inception, which emerged from a need to create impactful academic and industry collaborations for a greener future. Prof. Tewari extended her heartfelt gratitude to the Director, Prof. Himanshu Rai, and the keynote speakers for their invaluable insights and support in making the conference a platform for thought leadership and meaningful dialogue. The conference concluded with a vote of thanks by Associate Dean – Executive Education, Prof. Subin Sudhir. He mentioned that the conference stands reflects IIM Indore’s ongoing efforts to promote sustainable solutions and create a garbage-free future for cities worldwide. Previous Next

title: IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day – ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence’ to Celebrate International Partnerships – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day – ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence’ to Celebrate International Partnerships – IIM Indore IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day – ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence’ to Celebrate International Partnerships Home News And Events IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day – ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence’ to Celebrate International Partnerships navigate to IIM Indore Hosts International Partners’ Day - ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence’ to Celebrate International Partnerships IIM Indore, recognized for its global collaborations and commitment to strengthening cross-border academic synergies, hosted its inaugural International Partners’ Day—SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence—on October 09, 2024. The event was attended by an illustrious group of international academicians and thought leaders from seven countries, namely, USA, UK, Russia, France, Italy , Belgium, and Germany. The event served as a vibrant platform for enhancing institutional alliances, discussing the future of global education, and co-creating frameworks to nurture innovation and thought leadership. In his welcome address, Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore, emphasized the transformative power of international collaborations in advancing academic excellence. He highlighted the essence of SETU, a Sanskrit term meaning ‘bridge’, representing IIM Indore’s efforts to build robust connections with 58 premier institutions across 23 countries. These partnerships, he noted, aim to create bridges of knowledge and shared growth while addressing global challenges through joint research, faculty exchange, and collaborative academic initiatives. Prof. Rai also shared IIM Indore’s key initiatives focused on solving pressing urban and rural challenges, tackling inequality, mitigating environmental issues, and encouraging entrepreneurship. He stressed that the Institute’s programmes are designed to create leaders who not only excel in their respective fields but are also equipped to tackle these critical issues. The day-long celebration featured dynamic panel discussions, interactive presentations, and strategic dialogues, making it a truly engaging experience for all participants. A lively panel discussion on “The Future of Internationalization” included insights from Dr. Uttiyo Raychaudhuri, Vice Provost for Internationalization at the University of Denver; Dr. Belgin Somerville, Senior Lecturer at Adam Smith Business School; and Prof. Andrea Sianesi, Dean at MIP Politecnico di Milano Graduate School of Busines. Prof. Srihari Sohani, Associate Dean for Ranking, Accreditation, and Internationalization at IIM Indore, moderated the session. The panel delved into the evolving role of international partnerships, discussing how academic institutions can emerge as global citizens, adapt to diverse cultural contexts, and create inclusive ecosystems that go beyond transactional engagements. The panelists explored critical topics such as curriculum internationalization, creating global research ecosystems, and integrating digital technologies, offering actionable insights on how institutions can build sustainable partnerships based on trust and shared values. The event also featured presentations that showcased IIM Indore’s distinctive programmes aimed at strengthening community empowerment and sustainable development: Presentation on Executive Education: Prof. Subin Sudhir’s presentation on Executive Education highlighted IIM Indore’s unique approach to equipping professionals for the complexities of today’s global business environment. He spoke about how the Institute’s wide range of executive programmes caters to diverse professional needs, ranging from senior leaders to aspiring entrepreneurs. These programmes are tailored to address contemporary challenges, with a focus on leadership development, strategic management, and technology integration. Notably, IIM Indore has trained over 20 , 000 professionals and has a strong alumni base across the UAE, GCC, and other regions, showcasing its expanding global footprint and influence in shaping future leaders. Presentation on ANVESHAN, IIM Indore’s Centre of Excellence on Waste Management and WASH (Water, Sanitation and Hygiene): Prof. Shruti Tewari, Prof. Nishit Sinha, and Prof. Amit Vatsa shared how ANVESHAN bridges the gap between theory and practice through interdisciplinary research that addresses complex real-world challenges. They outlined how ANVESHAN is geared toward offering advanced training to policymakers, municipal leaders, and urban bodies on effective waste management, generating wealth from waste, and upholding cleanliness standards through innovative certification systems. Presentation on HOP (Himalayan Outbound Programme): Prof. Kamal Sharma discussed how HOP integrates leadership development and experiential learning in the challenging terrains of the Himalayas, preparing participants to become resilient, strategic leaders. Presentation on REP (Rural Engagement Programme): Prof. Srinivas Gunta emphasized the role of REP in nurturing entrepreneurial talent in rural regions. The programme engages participants in immersive, seven-day fieldwork in the rural areas of Madhya Pradesh, enabling them to co-create solutions that help sustainable development and bridge the rural-urban divide. The day concluded with enriching cultural exchanges, celebrating the diversity and vibrancy of the participating institutions. This event was more than an exchange of ideas—it was a reaffirmation of IIM Indore’s commitment to global partnerships that transcend geographical boundaries, fostering shared success and meaningful impact. Through ‘SETU: Bridging Academic Excellence’, IIM Indore has set a new benchmark in international academic engagement. The day was not just about academic discourse but also a celebration of global unity and cultural exchange. Delegates experienced the rich cultural heritage of India through immersive engagements, adding a personal dimension to the academic partnerships forged during the event. Against the serene backdrop of the campus, the delegates embraced the morning calm with a yoga session led by Prof. Himanshu Rai. He guided them through a series of stretches and breathing exercises. They were also treated to a captivating visit to the historic town of Maheshwar, a treasure trove of culture nestled along the serene banks of the Narmada River. Known for its ancient temples, intricate handloom sarees, and royal palaces, Maheshwar offered the delegates a glimpse into the region’s rich heritage. Furthermore, at IIM Indore, they were delighted to experience the vibrant Dhunuchi Pooja during the Navratri celebrations, an enchanting ritual known for its dynamic blend of dance, rhythm, and spirituality. The event was a celebration of shared vision, collective efforts, and the power of collaboration in advancing global educational goals. IIM Indore has consistently positioned itself as a pioneer in forging strategic global alliances and offering transformative educational experiences. With collaborations spanning 58 prestigious institutions across 23 countries, the Institute serves as a dynamic hub for thought leadership, academic innovation, and impactful research. By integrating international perspectives with local insights, IIM Indore ensures that its initiatives are not just globally relevant but also deeply connected to regional needs. Whether through cutting-edge executive education programs, global immersion projects, or community-centric engagements, IIM Indore continues to expand its footprint as a leader in creating meaningful global partnerships that drive excellence and innovation.
