title: The first batch of MSDSM Begins Online – IIM Indore
content: The first batch of MSDSM Begins Online – IIM Indore The first batch of MSDSM Begins Online Home News And Events The first batch of MSDSM Begins Online navigate to IIM Indore and IIT Indore collaborate to launch first-of-its-kind masters programme Two-year online master’s degree programme to receive a degree from IIMI and IITI 900 hours of learning, 15 hours live sessions every week, learning from the faculty of both the institutions IIM Indore aims to remain a contextually-relevant business school that offers world-class education for all. In line with its mission, the institute has collaborated with IIT Indore to launch a first-of-its-kind master’s degree programme. The two-year Master of Science in Data Science and Management is an online programme offering 15 hours of live sessions and a total of 900 hours of learning. The programme has been launched keeping in mind the rise in the demand for efficient data scientists and analysts who can drive an organization towards its success. The inauguration of the programme took place on March 21, 2022, in the presence of Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore; Prof. Suhas Joshi, Director, IIT Indore; Prof. Neelesh Kumar Jain, Former Acting Director and Faculty, IIT Indore; Prof. Amit Vatsa, Programme Coordinator – IIM Indore and Prof. Parimal Kar, Programme Coordinator – IIT Indore. Prof. Himanshu Rai expressed delight over the launch of this programme and welcomed the new batch. He shared views on how one can overcome the challenges amid the VUCA world. ‘Volatility can be countered by having a vision. The world is facing volatility, and it can only be overcome by having a vision. How to convert data into something meaningful is the program’s genesis, and your vision would help you utilize this learning. He advised the participants to add imagination to their vision and work towards creating a world they want to be a part of. He noted that ‘Uncertainty’ could be countered by ‘Understanding’ one another. You would gain immense knowledge from the brilliant faculty members of the institutions; however, the learning you would earn through interacting with your peers would be a life-changing experience. He suggested that the participants defeat ‘Complexity’ through ‘Courage.’ ‘Courage is one of the most important values, for if you aren’t courageous, you cannot have any other value,’ he said. He concluded by advising the participants to counter ‘Ambiguity’ by ‘Adaptability and Agility.’ ‘This world is changing drastically. You need to adapt to the new realities of the world, for the forthcoming years wouldn’t just rely on the survival of the fittest, but also the quickest – who is agile’, he said. Prof. Suhas Joshi, Director, IIT Indore, noted that businesses need a skilled workforce adept at management and data science tools and techniques in the post-pandemic scenario. ‘Thus, this comprehensive programme offered by the two leading institutes focuses both on business knowledge and technical skills, he said. Prof. Neelesh Jain also shared his views on the program’s significance and how this programme idea originated. ‘The programme would be focusing on four pillars of the programme, data, enterprise strategy, technology, and people. He said this robustly designed curriculum would aid the participants in numerous sectors of running a business. The ability to transform humongous data into better business decisions is the key to achieving success and retaining a position in the market for every business. This programme conducted by the faculty members of IIM Indore and IIT Indore would aid participants in identifying the areas where data science can add value and provide inputs to algorithm developers and data analysts, thereby contributing to creating a business impact. The programme includes sessions on machine learning, artificial intelligence, operations and supply chain management, marketing management, database management systems, programming languages and statistical methods, financial management, HRM, strategic management, information systems, ethics, etc., to name a few. A total of 41 participants from all over the nation have registered for the first batch of this unique programme. Previous Next

title: IIM Indore Celebrates Silver Jubilee, the 25th Foundation Day – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Celebrates Silver Jubilee, the 25th Foundation Day – IIM Indore IIM Indore Celebrates Silver Jubilee, the 25th Foundation Day Home News And Events IIM Indore Celebrates Silver Jubilee, the 25th Foundation Day navigate to Rau Circle to be re named IIM Indore Circle Indian Postal Services Release a Special Cover for the Silver Jubilee of IIM Indore IIM Indore Podcast I-View & Campus App Pocket-I launched Institute frees 25 caged birds on the auspicious occasion Rau Circle to be re named IIM Indore Circle Indian Postal Services Release a Special Cover for the Silver Jubilee of IIM Indore IIM Indore Podcast I-View & Campus App Pocket-I launched Institute frees 25 caged birds on the auspicious occasion Indian Institute of Management Indore (IIM Indore) completed its glorious 25 years on October 03, 2021. The Institute celebrated its silver jubilee on the Foundation Day held at the IIM Indore campus. The event was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore. Mr. Alpesh Shah, Managing Partner, Managing Director & Senior Partner, The Boston Consulting Group India was the chief guest for the occasion. Prof. Rai in his welcome address mentioned that the ‘special secret ingredient’ that helped the Institute grow over all these years is the faith in each other, trust in togetherness and conviction and commitment to the institute. ‘It is right to say that wherever you go in life is not so important. The important thing is who you are with. IIM Indore is a family and we are all together’, he said. He shared that the Institute focuses on constant growth and development of its participants, and now has foreign collaborations with over 40 universities in 16 nations. The Institute stands firm on its mission to remain contextually relevant and develop socially conscious leaders, managers and entrepreneurs who are determined to contribute to the nation building. He shared multiple initiatives taken by the Institute, right from providing food packets to the frontline warriors, to producing video modules for the teachers of the government schools in Madhya Pradesh. ‘It is with this determination of ours to contribute to the city, state and nation building, that we have now taken an initiative to develop the Rau Circle. I am happy to share that the Rau Circle will now be known as the IIM Indore Circle, and I assure you that we will develop the rotary and the landscape into a state-of-the-art area’, he announced. Let us just keep up the good work and have aspiration of more. Let us not stop dreaming, let’s not settle for less and let us not let anything discourage us, he concluded. Mr. Alpesh Shah in his Foundation Day Lecture congratulated IIM Indore community for completing its remarkable 25 years. He noted that the institute has progressed not only in the terms of rankings, but also in gender diversity. ‘It has been said that 50 percent of the brains in this world are women and we must have gender equality in every organization to become successful. IIM Indore has more than 42% of female participants and this is remarkable’, he said. He shared seven key elements for creating an institution: Define your purpose, Create a perfect team, Persist in sustained pursuit of excellence, Keep preparing, Run your own race, Be Bold and Live the values. ‘Every organization must have a purpose and that should be embedded in every stakeholder’s vision and mission. This can be achieved with a perfect team, for a perfect team isn’t about having perfect individuals, but recognizing the unique talents of every team member – to make a team perfect’, he said. Being a sports enthusiast, he shared multiple sports videos to explain how persistence and hard work helps a person succeed in life. ‘Life is a marathon and we need to prepare over and over again – to run our own race and not chase each other’, he said. He advised to always live the values- every single time, as values, morals and ethics help you become successful in life. On this occasion, an IIM Indore Special Cover by the Department of Posts was also released to memorialize the 25 years of excellence of the Institute. The special covers were revealed by Prof. Himanshu Rai; Mr. Alpesh Shah (Chief Guest); and Mr. Praveen Shrivastava, Superintendent of Post Offices, Indore Moffusil Division. The participants of IIM Indore have equally been contributing to the growth and progress of the Institute. This year, to make the 25 years special, the Media and PR committee of IIM Indore launched the official podcast – The I-View. The I-View aims at invigorating thought leadership by leveraging the holy triumvirate of IIM Indore’s faculty, alumni and the student community. The podcast will emphasis on contextually relevant topics ranging from ethical leadership, finance, marketing, management, and many more. uring the lockdown, the student-led Product Management club of IIM Indore – ProdLab recognized the requirements of the students of IIM Indore who are tech-savvy and choose to perform their day-to-day activities with just a tap on the screen. Hence began the conceptualization of the IIM Indore campus app, Pocket-I, which was launched on Foundation Day. The app aids the IIM Indore community members to connect, document notes and timetables, get information about the vendors on campus, sports facilities and booking slots, and much more. Every year, the Institute felicitates its teachers with the Best Teacher Award. This year, the award was presented to Prof. Jatin Pandey and Prof. Manoj Motiani who received a memento and a cash award of Rs. 1 Lakh each. The Best Staff Award was also announced on this occasion. The awardees included Mr. Unni KR (Rs. 40,000), Mr. DDV Prasada Rao, Mr. Anand Dodawad, Ms. Nisha Rathod, Mr. Vijay Kumar, and Mr. Pravah Shukla. All the awardees received a memento and a cash award of (Rs. 30,000 each). Employees who have been associated with IIM Indore for 10 and 20 years were also felicitated on this occasion with the 10/20 Years of Service Awards. These included Prof. KR Jayasimha, Prof. Swatantra, Mr. Unni KR and Dr. Baldev Dembani. On this occasion, the top 5 percentile of the PGP, PGPHRM and IPM participants also received their Certificate of Academic Excellence. On this occasion, IIM Indore also freed 25 birds from cages as a symbol for freedom, growth and prosperity. The event concluded with the national anthem. Previous Next

title: GMPE Dubai Batch 4 Graduates at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: GMPE Dubai Batch 4 Graduates at IIM Indore – IIM Indore GMPE Dubai Batch 4 Graduates at IIM Indore Home News And Events GMPE Dubai Batch 4 Graduates at IIM Indore navigate to The valedictory function of the 4 th Batch of General Management Programme for Executives-Dubai (GMPE) took place at IIM Indore on October 01, 2021. The programme is being conducted in association with Anisuma Training Institute in Dubai. Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore; Prof. Subin Sudhir, Chair-Executive Education and Prof. Manish Popli, Programme Coordinator & Faculty, IIM Indore were present. Prof. Rai gave certificates to all the 51 graduating participants for completing the course. Mr. Mahesh Chotrani, Founder Director-Anisuma Training Institute; Mr. Manohar Punjabi & Ms. Bhakti Mistry were also present on this occasion. Prof. Himanshu Rai shared an entirely insightful meaning of GMPe: ‘Grow’ every day; understand that ‘Money’ is merely an instrument’; be ‘Passionate’ and these will help you gain ‘Excellence’. ‘Our curiosity and the ability to learn differentiates us from animals. Learn and read every day, for that will help you know more and understand this universe in a better way’, he said. He advised the participants to find meaningfulness in their lives and invest in relationships, for focusing on earning money won’t help in achieving contentment in life. ‘Money is merely an instrument, and we instead need to focus on what we want to do with the money we earn and utilise it in a way that helps in making this world a better place to live in’, he said. He advised them to be passionate about everything they do. ‘Find out what makes you smile and what helps you bring smiles on other people’s faces. Add a tinge of compassion to your passion and you’ll be able to attain excellence in your life’, he concluded. Mr. Chotrani shared his delight over association with IIM Indore. He noted that the total strength of the IIM Indore alumni in Dubai, UAE is more than 350. This 10-month programme commenced November 2020 in Dubai and the participants visited the IIM Indore as a part of their 6-day module on campus. Apart from receiving the certificates, participants also gained lifetime executive alumni status with IIM Indore. The new batch of GMPe will be launching in December 2021. IIM Indore will also be launching an Advance Management Programme for Senior Executives next year in Dubai. Previous Next

title: Eleventh Batch of IPM Begins at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: Eleventh Batch of IPM Begins at IIM Indore – IIM Indore Eleventh Batch of IPM Begins at IIM Indore Home News And Events Eleventh Batch of IPM Begins at IIM Indore navigate to IIM Indore IPM completes a decade with the eleventh batch’s commencement The induction programme of the eleventh batch of the Five-Year Integrated Programme in Management (IPM) took place at IIM Indore on September 24, 2021. The batch was inaugurated by Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore. Mr. Gagandeep Singh, Country President and Managing Director, AstraZeneca Pharma India Limited was the Chief Guest for the occasion. Prof. Shruti Tewari, IPM Programme Chair; Prof. Sushanta Kumar Mishra, Dean-Programmes and Col. Gururaj Gopinath Pamidi (Retd), CAO, IIM Indore were also present during the inauguration. Prof. Himanshu Rai welcomed the new batch and shared an entirely new perspective for IPM: Integrity, Purpose and Meaningfulness. He noted that it’s important to understand that you can only be happy, content and successful if you say what you mean and do what you say. ‘Thoughts may be difficult to control as our mind travels as far in wakefulness as it does while we sleep. Controlling the thoughts might be difficult, but we need to ensure that our words, thoughts and actions are in harmony. This is where integrity comes in – the integrity to give your cent percent to every job you do and perform to your true potential, with a positive thought’, he said. He advised the new Batch to find their Purpose- the ‘P’ in IPM. Figure out the universe you want to live in, an equitable world with opportunities without any discrimination, full of justice, free of violence and oppression; and remember that you need to create that world for yourself. Sharing the significance of ‘Meaningfulness’, he encouraged the participants to be passionate about everything they do and be compassionate towards themselves and others. ‘Invest in yourself. Don’t carry anger for anyone or guilt about anything; for when you do, you are being violent towards yourself’, he suggested. Sharing insights from his journey, Mr. Gagandeep Singh explained to the new batch the importance of investing in relationships and life skills. ‘I realized during my journey that academic rigor isn’t enough, one also needs life skills to survive and be successful. You are going to learn as you grow and work together, and be able to find solutions to the problems of the community, and that’s what will make you content and satisfied, he said. India is all about solution-finders and creators; and the nation needs young minds who can analyse the problems and offer innovative and long-lasting solutions. Mr. Singh further elaborated and mentioned that there might be failures and disappointments while moving towards a goal, but one shouldn’t let fears affect the determination. ‘Keep moving forward and don’t let yourself get enclosed in negativity and fears. Try to focus on improving yourself just by one percent, regularly, again and again. That one percent brings significant results at the end and that’s when you will realise that you have had a great time full of learnings and experiences’, he said. Emphasising how global leadership helped us fight the pandemic, Mr. Singh said that together, we need to analyse the problems and find solutions, thereafter developing strategies to implement the solutions rapidly. ‘We realised that the production of the vaccine was based on the foundation that none of us would be safe till all of us are safe. Resilience played a very important role during this pandemic, and I feel fortunate to be a part of this journey’, he said. Addressing the new batch, he said that the values you learn at IIM Indore and the skills you develop will become your guiding light in the future. ‘IQ and discourse don’t matter as much as skills and resilience. Being a team player and collaborating is important and that will help you find success in life and profession. ‘Keep learning, keep upgrading yourself and always be curious. Being a learner helps you adapt to the changes and bring changes as well, for the betterment of the society’, he concluded. IIM Indore’s IPM has completed ten years this year, with the commencement of the new batch. On this occasion, the ‘Ten Years of IPM’ video was also launched by Prof. Himanshu Rai, which gave insights into the decade-long journey of the unique flagship programme, launched in 2011. The new batch also got an opportunity to interact with the Chief Guest. The first day of the induction programme witnessed an open house for parents with the Director and Programme Chair. The participants also were given briefings about the various hostel and student affairs and the facilities on campus. A session on the Government of India directive on Prevention and Prohibition of Ragging by IPM SAC Coordinator was also conducted. The new batch was excited to interact with IPM Batch 2014 Gold Medalist Radhika Khandelwal, who shared her journey of five years at IIM Indore with the participants. The second day of the induction programme will provide the new batch with an opportunity to interact with the faculty members. They would also get briefings on various facilities on campus including IT, Library and LMS. A session on Gender Sensitivity would also be held. Previous Next

title: IIM Indore Presents the Maiden “Lifetime Achievement Award for Excellence in Research” to Ramadhar Singh – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Presents the Maiden “Lifetime Achievement Award for Excellence in Research” to Ramadhar Singh – IIM Indore IIM Indore Presents the Maiden “Lifetime Achievement Award for Excellence in Research” to Ramadhar Singh Home News And Events IIM Indore Presents the Maiden “Lifetime Achievement Award for Excellence in Research” to Ramadhar Singh navigate to IIM Indore Presents the Maiden “Lifetime Achievement Award for Excellence in Research” to Ramadhar Singh IIM Indore was delighted to present the maiden “Lifetime Achievement Award for Excellence in Research ” to Ramadhar Singh , PhD, Distinguished University Professor, Ahmedabad University. Himanshu Rai, PhD, Director, IIM Indore presented this first-ever award by the Institute to Ramadhar Singh on June 20, 2021 in the Valedictory Session of the 11 th Annual “Conference on Excellence in Research and Education” (CERE 2021). Singh received this award for his basic contributions to the management and psychological literature on cognitive and social development, diversity and fairness, impression formation, interpersonal attraction, intergroup relations, job satisfaction, judgment and decision making, leadership, and prediction of performance during his 53 years in research. Singh has also been associated with IIM Indore since 2001, and has enriched the knowledge and skills of participants and faculty members by sharing his knowledge of recent advances in management and psychology. “By honoring Ramadhar Singh, with this maiden ‘Lifetime Achievement Award for Excellence in Research’, IIM Indore celebrates his commitment to and a quest for knowledge of human behavior in organization and society’, said  Director Rai. The citation is attached in the appendix. About the Lifetime Achievement Award Starting from this year, this award would be presented during the annual CERE to a senior Indian scholar with an exemplary track record in research. The three criteria for the award are that one should (1) have served  as the full professor at a premier institute/university for at least 25 years, (2) have made exceptional and impactful contributions to knowledge as evinced by one’s recognition as an outstanding researcher by academic peers and professional associations, and (3) be still active in quality research and publication. title: GMPE Dubai Batch 2 & 3 Conclude at IIM Indore – IIM Indore

title: MDP for Madhya Pradesh Police Officers Conducted at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: MDP for Madhya Pradesh Police Officers Conducted at IIM Indore – IIM Indore MDP for Madhya Pradesh Police Officers Conducted at IIM Indore Home News And Events MDP for Madhya Pradesh Police Officers Conducted at IIM Indore navigate to Top police officers attend a 3-day training programme at the Institute Programme conducted as a part of MoU signed with MP Police IIM Indore’s mission is to be socially conscious and the institute is always eager to contribute to the society and nation building. With the same objective, IIM Indore has signed an MoU with the Madhya Pradesh Police to further reinforce the professionalism between the two and also contribute to the development of a superior security environment and orderliness at public places through a mutual academic-practitioner collaboration system. In line with the MoU, IIM Indore conducted a Management Development Programme for the Madhya Pradesh Police Officers from March 16-18, 2021. The three-day programme was attended by 19 top officers ranked DIG, AIG, SP and Commandant from different districts of the state. The programme was inaugurated by Professor Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore; in the presence of Professor Mit Vachhrajani, Programme Coordinator & Faculty, IIM Indore and all the registered officers for the programme. Discussing about one of his favourite books—‘The Alchemist’ by Paulo Coelho, Professor Rai said that people often know their destiny and aren’t afraid to chase their dreams when they are young. However, people tend to get frightened to chase their dreams as they age; and to realise our own destiny should only be our obligation. He said that the fear of gaining or losing money and the fear of failure keeps us from giving our best to accomplish our dreams. ‘Money is what money does- nothing more and nothing less. Also, you don’t become a failure when you go wrong. You become a failure when you stop trying new things because you are scared to fail’, he explained.  He noted that this MDP would help the participants understand the nuances of negotiation and conflict; and will help them become a better negotiator—considering the fact that these frontline warriors have to face multiple challenging conflicts on day to day basis. The three day programme provided insights on various topics ranging from conflict management, basics of negotiation, behaviour assessment, creative problem solving and organizational transformation. The classes consisted of various case studies, readings and multiple interactive sessions with the proficient faculty from IIM Indore, who helped the officers enhance their knowledge and skills; which are crucial for leadership and administrative positions. Sharing that the programme has benefitted the officers in multiple ways, Mr. Manoj Rai, AIG, SISF, Police Headquarters Lal Parade Ground, Bhopal said that the course had been designed keeping in mind the important role of a senior police officer. ‘Police officers witness various conflicts on day to day basis. The programme provided us insights on how to take important decisions during conflicts in law and order, communal situations and accidents. We also learnt how to communicate in a better way and be public-friendly, which would help us gain the citizens’ trust’, he said. Such management programmes with excellent faculty members and experts help us in understanding how to implement strategic and management theories in real-life situations, how to solve problems in an effective manner and also enhances our learning process, he added. Ms. Ruchi Vardhan Mishra, DIG-Administration, Police Headquarters, Jahangirabad, Bhopal said that the programme helped the officers learn negotiation skills and how to deal a conflict so that it results in a with a win-win situation. ‘We as police officers are in various interactive role with the society, media and organization. The programme provided us an exposure to various strategies, modules and management principles which have helped us learn how theories and models can be implemented while interacting with the stakeholders of the society’, she said. Such programmes by an institute as prestigious as IIM Indore provide opportunities to the senior officers to enhance their learning skills and stay updated, she added. The three day MDP concluded on March 18, 2021 with certificate distribution to the officers for successfully completing the programme. The officers left the campus on a happy note and expressed their delight on being a part of this programme and for a joyous stay at IIM Indore. IIM Indore recently also conducted a Financial Literacy Workshop for the women and daughters of the police family of Indore Police Department. The Institute looks forward to organizing many more training sessions, workshops and seminars in future. Previous Next

title: IPBA Batch 3 and 4 Conclude at IIM Indore – IIM Indore
content: IPBA Batch 3 and 4 Conclude at IIM Indore – IIM Indore IPBA Batch 3 and 4 Conclude at IIM Indore Home News And Events IPBA Batch 3 and 4 Conclude at IIM Indore navigate to The valedictory function of the Integrated Programme in Business Analytics (IPBA Batches 3 & 4) took place at IIM Indore on March 13, 2021. The event took place in the presence of Professor Himanshu Rai, Director, IIM Indore; Professor Pritam Ranjan, Faculty Coordinator, IPBA; Professor Prashant Salwan, Chair-Executive Education and Mr. Kamal Das, Vice President-Operations, Jigsaw Academy. Congratulating the graduating batches, Professor Rai said that with this programme, the batch is not just gaining knowledge about IPBA, but also entering into a new world – a world of Integrity, Purpose, Boldness and Accountability. ‘To me, corruption is perversion of integrity. If you are not doing the best of what you are supposed to do with the best of your ability—you are corrupt. Integrity isn’t merely about saying or doing what you say. It is about the fact that whatever you say, whatever you do and whatever you think need to be in consonant—to create a world which is just and prosperous’, he said. He noted that one needs to find the purpose of their life, be passionate about it and get a sense of fulfilment. ‘Achievement without fulfilment is meaningless. Purpose gives you your identity and helps you find your objective of the life’, he explained. He said that one should be bold against the fear of losing money and the greed of money; the self-defeating belief of why you are not good enough; and the fear of trying something new—since one doesn’t become a failure if he or she fails, but becomes a failure when he or she stops trying. He encouraged the new batch to be accountable—accountable for their own life, life and actions. Professor Salwan and Professor Ranjan also congratulated the graduating batches. Mr. Das shared his delight over collaboration with IIM Indore. He advised the participants to think of business ideas and projects which they would like to work on after completing this programme. The programme concluded with certificate distribution to the participants for successfully completing the programme. Previous Next

title: IIM Indore Final Placements 2021 – IIM Indore
content: IIM Indore Final Placements 2021 – IIM Indore IIM Indore Final Placements 2021 Home News And Events IIM Indore Final Placements 2021 navigate to ndian Institute of Management (IIM) Indore has successfully completed the final placements for the batch of 2019-21 for its flagship Post Graduate Programme (PGP) and five years Integrated Program in Management (IPM). IIM Indore is the second business school in India to have achieved the Triple Crown consisting of the AACSB, AMBA & EQUIS accreditations. Ranked 7th in the NIRF rankings and 4th in India in QS rankings, IIM Indore became the fourth IIM and fifth Indian business school to be included in the top 100 list on the FT Global MBA Ranking 2021. In spite of the Covid-19 pandemic this past year, the recruiters showed continued faith in the Institute. More than 210 domestic and international organizations offered roles in various domains. “We are delighted by the continued faith the recruiters have shown in our students. Placing the largest number of students across all IIMs for the Final placements during the ongoing pandemic was a challenging task but the commendable efforts in setting up the virtual placement drive ensured hassle-free completion of the placements.” said Prof. Himanshu Rai, Director IIM Indore. The average domestic salary was recorded as 23.6 LPA (Lakhs Per Annum), displaying an increase of 3% from the previous year while the average salary of the top 100 students of the batch stood at 33 LPA. The highest domestic salary and the international salary offered this placement season was INR 41.5 LPA and INR 56.8 LPA, respectively. Apart from marquee recruiters, 40+ eminent first-time recruiters like Blue Star, NPCI, Paytm, PhonePe, TATA AIA chose to recruit from IIM Indore for multiple roles. Finance, Sales & Marketing and Consulting were the most sought-after domains with finance comprising 24% of the offers. A wide variety of roles ranging from investment banking and corporate banking to private equity and equity research were offered by top recruiters in the finance domain such as Bank of America, DE Shaw, Deutsche Bank, Goldman Sachs, HDFC Bank, ICICI, JP Morgan Chase & Co., Kotak Mahindra Bank, Morgan Stanley and State Street. Sales & Marketing was a sought-after domain this year as well with companies like AB InBev, Asian Paints, Enphase Energy, Hindustan Unilever Limited, ITC, L’Oreal and Marico making multiple offers to the candidates. With the e-commerce sector becoming the trending career destinations for students, companies like Amazon, Country Delight, Indiamart, Udaan, V2 Retail offered multiple roles to the candidates. IIM Indore proudly hosted coveted recruiters from the consulting domain including Bain Capability Network, Boston Consulting Group, Deloitte, Ernst & Young, Everest Group, GEP Consulting, Infosys Management Consulting, McKinsey & Company and PricewaterhouseCoopers in management consulting and strategy consulting roles. Recruiters such as Cognizant Business Consulting, Merilytics, MXV Consulting and Optum offered IT & technology consulting roles. General Management and Operations roles were offered by Bridgestone, Capgemini, Hero MotoCorp, L&T, JSW, Tech Mahindra and Whirlpool. Marquee recruiters like American Express, Genpact, Salesforce, Wipro and Yes Bank offered roles in IT/Analytics and Product Management roles. Previous Next
